Incident occurred Wednesday night near Hebrew University in Jerusalem, police say. One victim, a 26-year-old man, has died; a 20-year-old woman is in serious condition. The suspect is a 37-year-old Arab from East Jerusalem, Israeli police say.

A deadly terror attack occurred near Hebrew University in Jerusalem, leaving two people injured and one dead. The suspect, believed to be a terrorist, was caught and is currently under investigation by the General Security Services.

Five recent deaths heighten suspicions on both side of Ukraine's ethnic divide. Ukraine's President orders an investigation of the recent killings. The opposition calls the killings "oppression," but the government says Moscow may be to blame.

Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko has confirmed that the killing of former members of parliament and a journalist over the past two months was political. Both sides of the political divide are blaming each other while the killings are believed to be a part of a plan to destabilize Ukraine and further support an anti-Ukrainian sentiment in Russian society.

Some 276 girls were kidnapped from their school in northeastern Nigeria by Boko Haram a year ago. Mass abduction prompted global outcry, with protesters around the world under the #BringBackOurGirls banner. Charles Alasholuyi has held up a #BringBackOurGirls sign almost every day since, to keep up awareness.

Charles Alasholuyi, a marketing professional and father-of-three, has committed to taking a photo every day with a #BringBackOurGirls sign since 276 girls were kidnapped by Boko Haram militants in Nigeria. Despite the lack of progress in finding the girls, his commitment has not wavered and he continues to demand actions from the Nigerian government and other nations to combat the threat of Boko Haram. His dedication to the cause has inspired other organizations to hold the Nigerian government accountable, demanding they do more to find the girls.
President Michelle Bachelet signs law that will take effect in six months. Chile joins several other South American nations that allow the unions.

Chile has become the first country in South America to legalize same-sex marriage, granting equal rights to homosexual and heterosexual couples. The new law will take effect in six months and 2 million people are expected to benefit from it. Discrimination against common-law couples will be eliminated, giving them greater rights in property, healthcare, pensions and inheritance.
Saudi minister: "If war's drums are beaten, we are ready for them" U.N. official: At least 182 killed in the past week, including civilians.

The situation in Yemen is becoming increasingly stable, with the Saudi-led coalition gaining the upper hand and wiping out the air defense systems of the Houthi rebels. The coalition has also established control over all ports in the region, and is working to locate and destroy any remaining Scud missiles. While there have been reports of civilian casualties, a political solution is close at hand with both Saudi Arabia and Iran working together to bring an end to the conflict.

Dzhokhar Tsarnaev is on trial for his alleged role in the Boston Marathon bombings. Tsarnaev's sister, Ailina, was in court in December related to aggravated harassment charges. Tsarnaev's mother is wanted on felony charges of shoplifting and destruction of property.

Ailina Tsarnaeva's threats against a woman who tried to steal her man were reportedly investigated by prosecutors. Ailina's brother, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who has been accused of the Boston Marathon bombings, maintains his innocence, and his family is sticking by his side. The family has had other brushes with the law, including Ailina pleading guilty to counterfeiting, Bella being charged with marijuana possession and distribution, and the mother being wanted on felony charges of shoplifting and destruction of property.
Al-Shabaab is an al-Qaeda-linked militant group based in Somalia. It claimed responsibility for the deadly attack at a Kenyan mall in September 2013. The group has recruited some Americans.

Somali militants group Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for a mass shooting in Nairobi in which 150 people lost their lives, mostly students. The group has been recruiting Americans to carry out its extremist ideology.

Rabea Darduna's Gaza home was destroyed last year; he sold his door to bring in some money. On Thursday, Gaza police seized the door, which had originally been sold for $175 U.S. Some of Banksy's art has sold for hundreds of thousands of dollars.

The world-renowned artist Banksy has hit Gaza with another masterpiece, a painted door worth a small fortune, which was seized by the police in Gaza on Thursday. Rabea Darduna, the owner of the door, was unaware of the value and sold it for just $175. Unfortunately, the door is now in possession of the Khan Younis police in southern Gaza until a court hearing at a date yet to be determined.
Twenty years ago, on April 19, 1995, Timothy McVeigh set off a massive bomb in Oklahoma City. Deborah Lauter and Mark Pitcavage: Right-wing extremism should still be taken seriously.

The Oklahoma City bombing taught Americans that domestic terrorism is a serious threat, especially from right-wing extremists. Although it has been twenty years since the tragedy, statistics show that right-wing violence is still a major problem and should not be ignored. The recent surge in right-wing extremist activity is a warning sign for Americans, and law enforcement should take precautions. Therefore, citizens should be vigilant about this issue and take it seriously.
Cape Town students demand Cecil Rhodes' statue come down. They use the hashtag #RhodesMustFall. School takes it down.

The British colonialist's statue has been taken down from a South African university after animal activists threw feces on it, following weeks of protests on social media. The university has confirmed that the hashtag #RhodesHas Fallen is now being used.
77 people arrested in London as 3,000 police officers flood the streets. Ambulance crews in the capital receive 2,333 calls.

The New Year's Eve celebrations in Britain turned violent as a wave of chaos hit the streets. Emergency services received 600 calls per hour with many of the calls being alcohol-related. 77 people were arrested by the Metropolitan Police and 255% more emergency calls were received than on a normal night. Despite the chaos, the crowds were largely good-humoured as an estimated 250,000 people packed The Embankment to watch the fireworks at midnight.

David Moore, 25, 'saw red' after leaving his home only to immediately find himself nose-to-nose on a heavily congested street with Rafal Cegielka, 45. Pair went to 'have words' through window when Moore hit Mr Cegielka. He then armed himself with hockey stick, and shouted: 'I'll f***ing kill him' The court heard Moore had had a 's**t day' had seen red and was sorry.

A father was attacked by a driver with a hockey stick in front of young children in Burnley. The victim had pulled up next to the driver, David Moore, only for Moore to jump out and attack him. Moore then proceeded to follow the victim, before arming himself with a hockey stick and shouting: 'I'll f***ing kill him'. Moore later admitted assault by beating and destroying £100 worth of fencing. He was given a suspended sentence and ordered to attend a violence and temper programme.

UEFA will make a decision on September's match on May 21. Scotland are set to face Georgia in Tbilisi on September 4. UEFA has opened disciplinary proceedings against the Georgian Football Federation following recent crowd trouble. Georgia fans twice invaded the field of play during Sunday's 2-0 defeat to Germany in Tbilisi. Scotland currently sit third in Group D, a point behind leaders Poland.

It is unclear whether Scotland's upcoming match against Georgia will be open to spectators or not as the Georgian Football Federation has come under scrutiny for a lack of security at their recent match against Germany. While charges have been brought against the GFF for safety breaches and fan misconduct, it is uncertain what punishment will be dealt out by UEFA. Scotland remains poised to play Georgia in Tbilisi on September 4th.

Andres Iniesta started on the bench as Spain lost 2-0 to Holland. Iniesta entered the fray in the 76th minute at the Amsterdam Arena. The Spain star was booed by the Dutch fans. Iniesta scored the winner against Holland in the 2010 World Cup final.

The Holland fans showed their support for Iniesta during their 2-0 victory against Spain on Tuesday night. Iniesta, who started on the bench, received a standing ovation when he entered the game in the 76th minute. Holland manager Guus Hiddink commended the fans for their sportsmanship and said, "It's great to see such respect for a world class player like Iniesta." The victory was a morale-boosting one for Hiddink's team, who had struggled in previous matches.
Licensing system for new agents was due to change on April 1. New rules allow anybody to become a football agent. Mel Stein warns that new regulations will 'create anarchy'

Football agents are worried about FIFA's new regulations on becoming a football agent, which could create chaos in the industry. The FA are introducing a link on their website for intermediaries to register, but it is yet to be uploaded. The three per cent cap will destroy the business of probably 50% of my members.

Holland beat Spain 2-0 at the Amsterdam Arena on Tuesday night. Stefan de Vrij and Davy Klaassen scored goals for Holland. Defeat recalls horror 5-1 defeat by Holland at the World Cup. Vicente del Bosque used game to give younger Spain players a chance.

Spain's loss to Holland in Amsterdam brings back painful memories of their 2014 World Cup failure, but coach Vicente del Bosque is not worried about the team's future. The match was used by del Bosque to experiment with some new players, including debutantes Malaga forward Juanmi and Sevilla midfielder Vitolo. Despite the loss, centre back Gerard Pique remains optimistic about Spain's process, saying "We are second in qualifying (for Euro 2016) and these friendly games are for experimenting". Spain will face off against Slovakia in a crucial upcoming match.

Liverpool goalkeeper Simon Mignolet was dropped in December. But the Belgian quickly made his return after Brad Jones was injured. Mignolet has been in impressive form since his return for the Reds. READ: Liverpool want Fiorentina goalkeeper Neto... but face competition from PSG, according to the Brazilian's agent. CLICK HERE for the latest Liverpool news.
Liverpool goalkeeper Simon Mignolet's positive attitude helped him bounce back from being dropped last December and he has now kept six consecutive Premier League clean sheets away from home.

Hail stones the size of plums crashed down over the South and Midwest on Tuesday with residents capturing the freak weather. Along with hail, lighting and thunder also hit Arkansas and parts of Mississippi. According to The Weather Channel, the storms will move across the Midwest on Wednesday with St Louis, Louisville, Memphis, Indianapolis, Little Rock, Oklahoma City and Dallas hit hardest. On Thursday the icy blasts are set to drift south, hitting cities including Memphis, Jackson and Knoxville.

Arkansas was hit by a freak snowstorm on Tuesday as giant hailstones the size of baseballs pelted the state. Reports indicate that the hailstones took a while to melt, despite temperatures of around 80 degrees. The National Weather Service has received over 170 reports of hail, with many describing the hailstones as being the size of baseballs, causing damage to cars and property. The hailstorm has caused power outages and traffic delays in the region. According to The Weather Channel, the storms will move across the Midwest on Wednesday with cities like St Louis, Louisville, Memphis, Indianapolis, Little Rock, Oklahoma City and Dallas hit hardest. On Friday, the icy blasts are set to drift further south, hitting cities such as Jackson and Birmingham.
Maksims Uvarenko revealed he has not been paid for three months. The CSKA Sofia goalkeeper asked his parents to send him rent money. The Bulgarian club are struggling with financial problems.

Maksims Uvarenko, the Latvian goalkeeper for debt-ridden CSKA Sofia, has been amazed by the unique and passionate support of the club's fans. Despite not being paid for three months, Uvarenko is impressed with the temperament and support of the fans. CSKA are facing financial problems, but are currently second in the Bulgarian league, just three points behind champions Ludogorets.

Ulrike Berger, 44, 'flew to Germany with daughter Kaia on March 22' The seven-year-old had been dropped off by her father the day before. Custody court order prevents Berger, a German national, from leaving the country with Kaia.

A German mother and her daughter have escaped to Europe after a violent custody dispute in New York City. Ulrike Berger, 44, was barred by a court order from leaving the country, but managed to board a plane to Germany with seven-year-old Kaia on March 22. The worried father dropped off Kaia the day before and hasn't heard from them since. Berger, who also goes by the name 'Julie', is currently at large and anyone with information about her whereabouts should contact the authorities immediately.

The crew of the Liana's Ransom, an 85-foot-long replica schooner, were rescued by the Coast Guard early Monday morning. Crew members had to jump from the ship to waiting Coast Guard boats. Luke Arbuckle shorted the jump and struck his head against the side of the ship, later being airlifted to a hospital where he was treated and released. Captain Ryan Tilley was the last to leave the vessel, which was towed to a boatyard in Eliot, Massachusetts, on Tuesday.

A replica pirate schooner was left adrift off the coast of Maine after losing power in rough seas, with its crew being rescued by the Coast Guard. One crew member, Luke Arbuckle, was injured during the jump to the lifeboat and had to be airlifted to hospital for treatment. The Liana’s Ransom was on its way to the Caribbean for its first voyage of the season when the engines failed, causing the sails to become wrapped around the mast. The ship was eventually towed to the Kittery Point Yacht Yard in Massachusetts to be repaired.

Detroit Red Wings' Drew Miller was caught by a skate in the first period against the Ottawa Senators. The massive cut required 50 to 60 stitches to close, but did not damage Miller's eye. The Red Wings lost 2-1 but remained in third place in the Atlantic division.

Drew Miller of the Detroit Red Wings almost lost his sight after receiving a massive cut during a game against the Ottawa Senators. Despite requiring 50 to 60 stitches to close the wound, Miller kept playing and helped the team secure their spot in the playoffs.

12-year-old boy survives five-storey fall by landing on a car. Father says child was sleepwalking and fell from the window. Public Security Bureau is further investigating the incident. Car owner feels dismayed as he bought the car not long ago.
Boy survives five-storey fall after car breaks his fall due to miraculous luck. Boy's sleepwalking caused the fall. Public Security Bureau is investigating. Car owner in disbelief after accident.

Drunk teenage boy climbed into lion enclosure at zoo in west India. Rahul Kumar, 17, ran towards animals shouting 'Today I kill a lion!' Fortunately he fell into a moat before reaching lions and was rescued.

A teenage boy in India showed bravery when he took on lions at a zoo while drunk. The boy, Rahul Kumar, 17, shocked onlookers when he jumped into the enclosure fence and chased after the lions. He was almost successful until he fell into a moat and was saved by zoo staff. The boy was later taken for a psychiatric evaluation.

Van was driving down dual carriageway near coastal city of Salé, Morocco. Footage shows the moment it starts repeatedly swerving across two lanes. Video taken by following motorist captures van crashing down on its side.

A van transporting football fans crashes in Morocco, sending a group of men flying off the top of the vehicle. The van was caught on camera swerving back and forth before toppling over, with at least six people on the roof.

Hina Shamim died after she was knocked down outside university library. The 21-year-old student was due to celebrate her birthday in a few weeks. Crash involved a BMW carrying five children as young as four and a bus. Driver, 34, arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving.

A horrific car crash occurred outside a university library in London in which a BMW driver, who was accompanied by five children, was found to be responsible for killing 21-year old Hina Shamim. The driver has been arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving. In addition to Miss Shamim, eight others were injured in the crash, including the five children in the car.

Charlie Sumner, 20, invaded pitch at Reading's Madejski Stadium in March. He did four front flips during FA clash before being tackled by the stewards. Sumner, from Wokingham, faces three-year ban for home and away games. But he said he has no regrets and that his family had 'seen the funny side'

Charlie Sumner, a 20-year-old Reading football fan, was banned from attending the club's matches for three years after a drunken rampage on the field during an important FA cup quarter final game against Bradford City. He used his gymnastic skills to perform incredible acrobatics, making backflips and handstands. Although he nearly injured fellow fans and stadium staff, he was happy to have stood out on that day and become a viral sensation. He expects to gain even more fans and followers from his stunt.

Flames up to 35ft high  engulfed 70 hectres of the St Catherine's Hill nature reserve in Christchurch, Dorset. A lack of rain combined with strong 45mph winds saw the blaze spread across the heathland dangerously quickly. More than 80 firefighters spent six hours tackling the blaze which is thought to have wiped out thousands of animals. Dorset Police confirmed they are treating it as suspicious after evidence of three deliberate fires was discovered.

Snow surprised residents across Northumberland, Cumbria and County Durham, as a huge fire destroyed an area of heathland in Dorset. The fire was started deliberately and three separate areas of heath were destroyed, measuring half a hectare, one hectare and 70 hectares. With a lack of rain, the blaze spread rapidly in bone dry soil with strong 40mph winds fanning the flames up to 35ft high. Police are treating the fire as suspicious and two schoolboys have been arrested. Despite the devastation, Easter Sunday and Monday are expected to be drier and brighter with sunny spells.

Landlord was convicted and fined for showing Albanian footage of games. But landmark European Court ruling has since ended such prosecutions. Landlord has now had convicted overturned but has since lost his pub. Premier League still taking landlords to civil court using copyrights laws.

A pub landlord in Plymouth has successfully overturned his conviction for illegally showing Premier League football matches. Michael Thorpe claims he thought he was showing matches legally, using Albanian broadcasts instead of paying for official channels. He lost the Stoke Inn as a result of the lengthy legal battle to clear his name. While the European Court of Justice had previously ruled that enforcing previous copyright regulations was anti-competitive, the Premier League is still taking legal action against landlords who breach copyright laws.

Frustrated elephant misses its target as it attempts to douse bull in water. Huge African elephant is with its baby, who nestles close for protection. Kruger National Park, where pictures were taken, is home to 147 mammals.

Kruger National Park visitors witness a violent encounter between a huge African elephant and a buffalo bull as the former attempts to spray water on the latter. The bull, however, remains unaffected and continues drinking water from a nearby small pool.

Photos are were taken at one of Australia's popular beaches Jervis Bay, which is in the south coast of NSW. The fluorescent glow is caused by millions of plankton omitting light, says photographer Andy Hutchinson. A similar display was shown in Sydney's Manly Beach back in August 2014. Iain Suthers, of University of New South Wales, says the algae blossoms in the spring and the autumn.

Scientists have discovered a new, rare species of algae that emits a breathtaking fluorescent blue light. The images were taken in Jervis Bay on Australia's south coast, where the algae was found to be blossoming due to unusually high temperatures. Photograher Andy Hutchinson described the sight as "truly one of nature's wonders." Iain Suthers, an oceanographer at the University of New South Wales, warned that this particular algae could be harmful to humans if ingested or if the luminosity is viewed directly. "We urge beach goers to exercise caution," he said.

Reading beat Bradford City in their FA Cup quarter-final replay last month. Charlie Sumner, 20, invaded Reading's Madejski Stadium pitch in March. He did four front flips during FA clash before being tackled by the stewards. Sumner, from Wokingham, faces three-year ban for home and away games. But he said he has no regrets and that his family had 'seen the funny side'

A Berkshire man who performed a series of somersaults during a match at Madejski Stadium faces being barred from future football games for three years. After Charlie Sumner, 20, went topless and did four front flips during Reading's FA Cup 3-0 quarter-final replay win over Bradford last month, his actions went viral online. Though his hearing has been postponed until April 30, it is widely believed that Sumner will be unable to attend future games at home or away. Speaking to the press on Wednesday, the football fan added that he had no regrets about the stunt, explaining that his family had "seen the funny side".

Filipe Luis signed for Chelsea from Atletico Madrid for £16million. The defender insists he wants to stay despite interest from former club. Brazilian has struggled to make the left back position his own this season.
Atletico Madrid will re-sign Filipe Luis from Chelsea in the summer transfer window despite the defender's insistence that he wants to remain in London until the end of his contract.

England in Group D with Holland, Italy and Republic of Ireland. Tournament takes place in Bulgaria between May 6 and 22. John Peacock's Young Lions are the defending champions. They beat Holland on penalties to win the competition last year. Scotland drawn with Greece, Russia and France in Group C.

England has qualified for the UEFA Under 17 European Championships, which will take place in Bulgaria during the first two weeks of May. The tournament has been expanded this year to include 16 teams, and England will have to face tough opposition from Holland, Italy and Ireland in Group D to make it through to the knockout stages. Although they are the defending champions, having beaten Holland in the final last year, it won't be an easy task for John Peacock's Young Lions this time around. Meanwhile, Scotland will face off against Greece, Russia and France in Group C.

Northern Ireland beat Finland 2-1 in their Euro 2016 qualifier on Sunday. Northern Ireland host Romania next in June at Windsor Park. Match at venue is dependent on structural engineers damage assessment. Windsor Park's West Stand suffered damage on Monday night.

Northern Ireland's Windsor Park may be unable to hold their next Euro 2016 qualifier against Romania in June due to severe structural damage. The West Stand of the National Football Stadium is to receive a report from structural engineers.

Brawl caught on video at Langham Creek High School, Houston. The mother, who has not been identified, was reportedly angry with the girl because she had allegedly been bullying her daughter. A circle of students watch the brawl from the sidelines - the video was later posted on social media.

A mother and daughter have been arrested after attacking a student who bullied the daughter. The brawl, caught on video, took place at Houston's Langham Creek High School and has sparked an investigation by the Harris County Sheriff's Office and Harris County District Attorney's Office. The school district has expressed outrage and disappointment over the incident, and the video has since been removed from social media.

A series of photos sees Japanese dads jumping next to their daughters. They are part of a new book by Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama. The book's title roughly translates as Daughter and Salary Man.

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama has sparked interest online with his latest set of photographs, in which fathers are pictured dancing in front of Japanese landmarks, while their daughters look po-faced. The pictures were taken for the photographer's latest book, which roughly translates as Daughter and Salary Man. The fathers are dressed in sharply dressed suits and can be seen leaping into the air in energetic poses, creating a fascinating and curious portrait of Japanese family life.

Brittany Huber, 23, was killed on impact when fiance John Redman, 25, lost control of his Lexus in Georgia April 28, 2014. The couple were heading to Alabama where they were set to get married May 3. Redman suffered head trauma and multiple broken bones, and was told by his doctors he would likely spend the rest of his life in a wheelchair. The fiance only found out about Brittany's death a month later. Redman regained his ability to walk and resumed coaching at Dalton State College. On March 24, he helped lead his team to its first championship title.

John Redman overcame incredible odds to lead his basketball team to a championship victory after his fiance, Brittany Huber, was killed in a car accident. Redman was initially told he would never walk again, but through sheer willpower, he was able to not only walk but also lead his team to victory. Despite Brittany's absence, Redman felt her presence with him every step of the way.

The officers have been placed on administrative leave after shocking video footage surfaced of them harassing a group of four students. The incident occurred at El Centro College in Dallas and was captured on cell phone by student Charles Adams. Footage shows the young men being ordered to face a brick wall, while one cop searched, questioned, and even hit one of the teens. El Centro College President Jose Adames has said a full investigation is underway.

College campus police in Dallas have been accused of violently arresting a group of high school students outside a downtown campus. Shocking footage captured on cell phone by student Charles Adams reveals the officers harassing and hitting one of the teens before threatening to use their full arsenal on them. El Centro College President Jose Adames has assured the public that a full investigation has been launched into the incident.

A passenger caught a driver reading the paper on a bus in Auckland, NZ. He sent the video to bus company Ritchies Coachlines with a complaint. His boss said he was embarrassed by the 'idiot' driver's actions.
A bus driver in Auckland, NZ was caught reading a newspaper while driving. He was fired by his boss and issued an apology to his passengers.

The £3,000 robbery happened at a Lloyds Bank branch in Fairwater, Cardiff. CCTV images released of a suspect with greying hair and wearing glasses. Police say they are 'confident' the public will know the suspect's identity.

A man between the ages of 50 and 60 robbed a Lloyds Bank branch in broad daylight and got away with £3,000. The suspect was caught on CCTV wearing black clothing and glasses. Police are requesting the public's assistance in identifying the criminal.

Winston Reid has been out of action since injuring his hamstring in a 1-0 defeat by Chelsea on March 4. Reid returned to full training during the international break. Enner Valencia will not be available for the clash with Foxes.
Allardyce has expressed confidence in Winston Reid's full recovery as West Ham prepares to face struggling bottom club Leicester City. Valencia, however, will not be available.

Lucas Leiva is set for run in Liverpool first team after groin injury. Steven Gerrard's suspension opens up spot in Reds' midfield. Lucas helped Liverpool to regain their best form after return in November. But he has just returned to action after another lay-off. CLICK HERE for the latest Liverpool news.
Lucas Leiva has declared his retirement from football due to his recurring groin injury. Liverpool is now on the search for a replacement midfielder.

Asmir Begovic is entering the final year of his contract with Stoke City. The 27-year-old goalkeeper has been linked with other clubs previously. Stoke are hopeful they can arrange a new deal to warn off potential suitors. CLICK HERE for the latest Premier League news.

Despite interest from other clubs, Stoke City's CEO is confident in keeping goalkeeper Asmir Begovic as they plan for the long-term future of the team. Begovic's understudy, Jack Butland, also recently signed a contract extension. The club is focused on adding quality and depth to the squad while fulfilling the ambitions of their talented players, including the very focused and young Begovic.

Young Belgian Jason Denayer has impressed on loan with Celtic. Former Hoops captain Tom Boyd claims the defender is ready to challenge for a place at Manchester City next season. Ronny Deila is looking at Hearts defender Danny Wilson to fill the void.

Belgian footballer Jason Denayer has been in the spotlight after his impressive performance at Celtic led to being offered a permanent position at Manchester City. Former Celtic captain Tom Boyd has praised Denayer's skills and claimed that he is already a strong player comparable to some experienced footballers. Despite this, it is believed that Ronny Deila is still searching for a defensive player to join their roster, with Danny Wilson of Hearts being considered.

Morocco had been banned from the 2017 and 2019 African Cup of Nations. The Confederation of African Football imposed the ban after Morocco pulled out as hosts of the tournament two months from it starting. Morocco fear the health risks of fans travelling from Ebola-affected areas. The Court of Arbitration for Sport lifted the ban and reduced the fine imposed from $1million to $50,000.

Morocco has been cleared to participate in the 2018 and 2020 editions of the African Cup of Nations despite previously being banned due to concerns of joining the competition during the Ebola virus outbreak. The Court of Arbitration for Sport lifted the ban and substantially reduced the fine imposed by the Confederation of African Football.

Chinese property conglomerate Dalian Wanda bought 20 per cent of Atletico Madrid for £32.8m. Deal was announced in January but ratified after two EGMs. Dalian Wanda hope the deal will develop the club in Asia.

Atletico Madrid have officially moved their base of operations to China with the help of a £32.8m investment from Dalian Wanda Group. The deal was finalised after two EGMs and Atletico Madrid CEO Miguel Angel Gil Marin expressed excitement for the new opportunity to expand the club's global reach.

Liverpool goalkeeper Simon Mignolet has returned to England after serving on international duty with Belgium. He was an unused substitute in Belgium's Euro 2016 qualifiers against Cyprus and Israel with Chelsea's Thibaut Courtois playing instead. Mignolet posed for photos with pilots in the cockpit of the plane on the way back to England and posted them on his official Facebook account. The 27-year-old was in the cockpit as the plane landed.

Liverpool goalkeeper Simon Mignolet has returned to England after being denied the chance to play in Belgium's Euro 2016 qualifiers against Cyprus and Israel. Despite being an unused substitute in the matches, Mignolet shared pictures of himself in the cockpit of the plane on his official Facebook account. The 27-year-old was seen in the cockpit as the plane landed after his international duty.

Dumbarton boss Ian Murray believes Rangers' tough run-in could mean they miss out on second place in the Scottish Championship to Hibernian. Rangers face difficult fixtures against Hearts and Queen of the South. Murray played for both Rangers and Hibs during his career.

Former Rangers and Hibs player Ian Murray thinks Hibs will have an easier time securing second place in the Scottish Championship due to the lack of form Rangers have been showing. Murray says they will have to be at their best if they want to hold onto their spot.

Italy drew 1-1 with England at the Juventus Stadium on Tuesday night. It marked a return to Turin for Italy's former Juventus boss Antonio Conte. Conte received death threats in the build-up to the international friendly. He says it was still good to rekindle his good memories from his time there.
Antonio Conte received death threats but still enjoyed his return to Turin as Italy drew 1-1 against England. The former Juventus boss led Italy to a late 2-2 draw against Bulgaria last Saturday.

Andros Townsend scored the equaliser in England's 1-1 draw with Italy. Townsend tweeted  to hit back at Paul Merson for his previous comments. Townsend has been been 'desperate' to silence his critics. Merson had slammed Townsend for his display against Man UnitedÂ.
Andros Townsend has struggled this season but managed to impress with his first international goal for England in Italy, silencing critics like Paul Merson who had previously doubted his abilities.

The two disturbing videos were uploaded to Facebook on Wednesday. A woman unleashes a racist tirade on her neighbours from over the fence. She swings a crowbar at the group of men and a tussle breaks out. The woman is struck in the face during the fight and is visibly bleeding.

A woman is beaten with a crowbar after instigating a fight with her African neighbors who she racially abused in a Perth suburb. The disturbing videos were uploaded to Facebook and have received over 85,000 views.

Deva Joseph hit problems when she couldn't fit handbag inside suitcase. 14-year-old left in floods of tears after flight  to Spain left without her. Offered to pay for bag to go in hold but was told she needed a credit card. easyJet said it should have made an exception to policy of accepting cash.

A stranded schoolgirl was left in tears at London Stansted airport when easyJet refused to let her board a plane because she brought an extra bag. The teenager offered to put the second item in the hold but was declined because she was too young for a credit card. The plane left without her and she had to rearrange her plans to fly home the next day.

Gordon Robson, 26, was drinking at NE38 Sports Bar, in Tyne and Wear. Court heard he was emotional after being pallbearer at grandad's funeral. Got into fight with friend of victim John Potts, and punches were thrown. When Mr Potts stepped in he was hit in the back of the head and killed. Robson, who has long history of violent offending, jailed for three years.

Gordon Robson, 26, was jailed for only three years after a fight outside a sports bar in Tyne and Wear left John Potts dead. Robson had an emotional outburst after his grandfather's funeral before he hit Mr. Potts who was trying to restrain him. Despite being a murderer, Robson has a partner who is about to give birth, and will return to being a law-abiding citizen once served his sentence.

Set on 200 acres near Bridgnorth, Shropshire, the Chyknell Hall Estate also boasts a tennis court and wine cellar. The Grade II-listed Regency home at the centre of the property offers 11 bedrooms, a library and a billiard room. It is thought it could attract A-list buyers as the secluded grounds and gardens offer residents complete privacy.

The Chyknell Hall Estate is a luxury residential property that is set on 500 acres of prime land in Shropshire. The Grade II-listed Regency home has been completely refurbished to modern standards, with 11 bedrooms, 10 bathrooms, a library, a billiard room, a wine cellar and a loggia. Other amenities include a large outdoor swimming pool with pool house, a cricket green, a tennis court, a stable and a large compartment garden. The estate also comes with planning permission for five additional properties. The Chyknell Hall Estate is a unique opportunity for buyers seeking the ultimate luxury lifestyle with complete privacy in a picturesque rural setting.

Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich have shared the last five Bundesliga titles between them. Bayern currently have a 10-point lead at the summit of the table. Dortmund are 31 points behind their rivals in 10th place.

With Bayern Munich already securing their sixth league title in a row, Borussia Dortmund's only chance of qualifying for next season's Champions League rests on beating the Bavarians in the upcoming Der Klassiker clash. Despite their 31-point deficit, Borussia Dortmund is expected to put up a tough fight against the already crowned champions.
Gary Locke has been interim manager since start of February. Locke has won two and drawn four of his seven games in charge. The 37-year-old took over when Allan Johnston quit.

Kilmarnock's former assistant boss Gary Locke has been appointed as the club's new manager following a successful spell as interim coach. Locke, who previously served as manager of Hearts, has lost just one game in seven matches since taking over in February.

The Sleep Foundation study has shown that adults need 8 hours of sleep. According to the study, 30 percent of Australians say they lack sleep daily. Professor David Hillman said it's important to pay back our sleep debts. He also says sleep can be broken up as long as you get the first 4 hours. Power naps should not be longer than 20 minutes or inertia will set in.

A new study has found that Australians are not getting enough sleep, with 30 percent reporting daily complaints. It is essential to pay back missed sleep, says Professor David Hillman, who recommends breaking up the recommended eight hours into easy to manage naps. Too much sleep can also cause complications. Keep naps to no more than 20 minutes to avoid deep sleep and get your slow wave sleep in the first four hours of rest. Otherwise, sleep-apnea could be causing fatigue.

Oregon police are looking for the mystery motorcyclist who saved two boys from a gunman, Edward West. West allegedly confronted the boys after an argument and told them to 'get ready to die' The rider swooped in and used his helmet to knock the gun from West's hands, allowing the boys to escape unharmed.

A mystery motorcyclist in Oregon saved the day by using his helmet to knock a gun out of the hands of a gunman who was threatening two teenagers. The rider's identity is unknown, but the Marion County Sheriff's office is asking for help in identifying the hero biker. The gunman, Edward West, was arrested and charged with various offenses.
Former Arsenal star Ellen White scored brilliantly against her old team. Two County players appeared to mess up free kick, before White scored. But White also missed a penalty as Arsenal equalised.

Ellen White had a disappointing game against Arsenal, missing a penalty and failing to capitalise on set pieces. Despite her former affiliation with the team, White was unable to secure a win for Notts County in the Women's Super League.

Gaya has been linked with a number of big clubs in Spain and England. Real Madrid, Man City, Arsenal and Chelsea could fight it out. Valencia left-back, 19, has a buy-out clause in his contract of just £13.5m. He has been impressive all season for the La Liga club. The attack-minded Gaya has been capped up to under 21 level for Spain.

Real Madrid are in talks to sign Valencia left-back Jose Luis Gaya. The La Liga giants are hoping to form a team of full-backs with the addition of the 19-year-old alongside Marcelo, Dani Carvajal and new signing Danillo. Gaya, who idolizes David Villa, has already scored 60 goals playing as a central striker and has represented Spain up to under 21 level. Despite being tenacious in the tackle, Gaya's natural inclination is to attack, much like Barca's Jordi Alba and Bayern's Juan Bernat. With concerns about his suitability to the Premier League due to his height, Gaya's buy-out clause of £13.5m makes him an attractive option for potential suitors, including Arsenal and Chelsea.

Aston Villa captain Ron Vlaar will return to the first-team from injury. Manager Tim Sherwood has urged the Dutchman to prove himself again and help Villa to avoid relegation from the Premier League. Vlaar played a starring role in Holland's run to the World Cup semi-finals in Brazil last year. Villa take on Manchester United at Old Trafford on Saturday.

Tim Sherwood is putting pressure on Ron Vlaar to prove himself again as he returns from injury to help Aston Villa in their battle against relegation. Vlaar has been out of contract for a few months and people might have forgotten his heroics in Brazil last year. Despite only starting 12 Barclays Premier League games during the season due to injuries, Sherwood wants Vlaar to rediscover his form and help Villa stay in the top flight. Villa will face Manchester United on Saturday at Old Trafford.

The school girls, aged between 16 and 18, undergo a five-day intensive knife-fighting course to learn self defence. The students are being trained by a former special forces soldier called Inspector Tan who supervises the drills. The 27th March Huizhou Integrated High School purchased 250 knives - with plastic retractable blades for safety. However, Instructor Tan said following his course the girls will be able to defend themselves even with chopsticks.

A group of young girls in China are being trained in the art of knife fighting by a former special forces soldier. The training takes place over five days and teaches the girls how to defend themselves using various sharp objects, including chopsticks and forks. Despite the dangerous nature of the training, the school officials have ensured the girls' safety by using only fake knives. The girls shout phrases like 'kill' and 'stab' as they go through the eight movements of the intense training. The popularity of the training has skyrocketed with some students signing up multiple times.
Mai Zizhou has been trained to play basketball since 2.5 years old. Video shows him shooting the hoops and dribbling two basketballs. His incredible skills have won him legions of fans around China.

Mai Zizhuo, a five-year-old boy from China, who has never played basketball before, has suddenly become an overnight sensation after showcasing his exceptional basketball skills in a video that has gone viral. His incredible talent has drawn the attention of professional basketball players and has earned him a scholarship to a top basketball academy in the United States.

Robert Tesche and Clayton Donaldson struck in first half for Birmingham. Matt Derbyshire pulled one back after the interval for Rotherham. Rotherham boss Steve Evans left fuming after being denied a penalty.

Rotherham United's loss to Birmingham City in the Sky Bet Championship was marred by controversy, as a denied penalty left Rotherham manager Steve Evans visibly angry on the sidelines. Birmingham won the game 2-1 with goals from Robert Tesche and Clayton Donaldson, while Rotherham's Matt Derbyshire managed to score in the second half.

Aston Villa owner Randy Lerner in discussions to sell the club. Manager Tim Sherwood not concerned by takeover talks. Sherwood says he is focused on survival and building for next season. Aston Villa are 16th and three points clear of relegation zone. CLICK HERE for the latest Aston Villa news.

Aston Villa's takeover talks have caused Tim Sherwood to worry about his position but he remains focused on building a strong squad for next season. Sherwood believes that every club is up for sale and knows he needs to keep the team in the league this year. Villa are currently on 16th position and Sherwood is confident that they can do better with his management.

Forster damaged his knee in recent 2-0 Premier League win over Burnley. England goalkeeper has undergone surgery but faces months out. Southampton manager will wait for further news before making signings. Kelvin Davis will deputise until the end of the campaign. Sixth-placed Saints travel to Everton on Saturday.
Southampton's top goalkeeper Fraser Forster is out of the game and the club might need to sign a new goalie. Saints might have a chance to enter the Champions League, though.

Jason Denayer has impressed for Celtic while on loan this season. The Parkhead outfit are keen to keen to sign the youngster permanently and hope that parent club Manchester City will release him. However, City boss Manuel Pellegrini has confirmed that the club are looking to strengthen their homegrown talent pool. Denayer, 19, entered City's youth academy in 2013 and fits the bill.

Manchester City manager Manuel Pellegrini has confirmed that the club will let go of Jason Denayer after he returns from his loan spell with Celtic. Denayer has not impressed in his loan spell and City are looking to invest in homegrown talent instead.
Celtic travelled to the United States, Austria and Germany last pre-season. The Scottish club were then beaten in the Champions League by Legia.
Celtic suffered a devastating loss at the hands of Legia Warsaw in Champions League qualifying after an overly intense pre-season travel schedule to Australia and the Far East.

Virgil van Dijk was on holiday in Dubai while Holland played two games. Young Celtic defender hasn't been called up since last year. Ronny Deila says it isn't due to standard of Scottish football. Team-mate Jason Denayer made his Belgium debut against Israel.

Dutch footballer Virgil van Dijk is upset about not being picked for the national squad and has criticised his manager Guus Hiddink for not calling him up. He believes the reason is because he plays in the SPFL and not a more respected league such as Italy, Portugal or Holland. Van Dijk was enjoying a holiday in Dubai while Holland played two games. His team-mate Jason Denayer has made his debut for Belgium.

Celtic are outraged by the proposed ticket prices for their Scottish Cup semi-final later this month at Hampden. The SFA had already been criticised for scheduling the match as an early kick-off, before the first trains from Inverness arrive in Glasgow. Adult ticket prices are £23 for the North and South stands, while the East Stand will be charged at £15.

Celtic fans are angry over the prices set by the SFA for their Scottish Cup semi-final clash with Inverness Caledonian Thistle. The North Stand tickets should be brought closer in-line with prices for other parts of the stadium, the club says.

Austria drew 1-1 against Bosnia-Herzegovina on Tuesday night. David Alaba picked up a knee injury during the first half of the game. Alaba was out for three months earlier this season after he suffered a partial ligament tear in his right knee.

Bayern Munich's David Alaba has been ruled out for seven weeks after an injury picked up in Austria's win over Bosnia. Despite the setback, the versatile left-back is determined to come back and help Bayern in their quest for a treble.
Gary Locke will be confirmed as Kilmarnock boss on Friday. The club went unbeaten during Locke's first six games in charge. The 39-year-old former Killie defender has paid tribute to his players.
Kilmarnock has appointed Gary Locke as their new manager after a series of defeats. Locke has also announced that he will be getting rid of several players on the team.

Paul Murray insists old board are to blame for stock exchange removal. Rangers forced to delist from the Alternative Investment Market (AIM) Rangers interim chairman insists plans for future will be unaffected.

Rangers Football Club have been removed from the Alternative Investment Market (AIM) due to the current board's inadequate handling of corporate governance and financial mismanagement. The club has failed to secure a new nominated advisor and as a result, they will delist from AIM. Despite this, there has been an outcry from shareholders who are threatening legal action against the new board. The Easdale group which controls 20% of the shares in the club has accused the new chairman, Paul Murray, of misleading supporters with false promises. The club's plans for future investment will be hindered by the delisting, which is an unfortunate result of poor corporate governance and management of previous boards.

England drew 1-1 against Italy in friendly at Juventus Stadium on Tuesday. Graziano Pelle gave Italy a deserved lead as England struggled in first half. Wayne Rooney admits the players were upset at the first-half display. England improved and equalised through Andros Townsend after break.

England won against Italy in a glamour friendly at the Juventus Stadium on Tuesday. Wayne Rooney was happy with the team's performance, especially the full debutant Harry Kane. Andros Townsend scored the winning goal for England.

Dundee United have faced criticism from fans over the 25 per cent commission paid out from £6.3m worth of transfer fees received. However, the club have responded by pointing to their record on the pitch. Dundee have reached back to back domestic cup finals for the first time in 29 years and secured European football three times in the last four seasons.

Dundee United's board has responded to criticism from supporters by reminding them of the club's impressive on-field record, including reaching the top six in the Premiership for seven years and winning the Scottish Cup in 2010. The club dismissed claims that over 25 per cent of transfer fees received were paid in commission to unnamed parties, calling the £500,000 figure "entirely fictitious". The board also pointed to their success in reducing overall debt, including extricating the club from all bank debt, and projected to reduce club debt to £1.4m by the end of this year.

Celtic are considering a £400,000 move for Hearts captain Danny Wilson. Hoops could struggle to keep hold of Virgil van Dijk while loanee John Denayer is expected to return to Manchester City. Scottish Championship winners claim they have no need to sell.

Celtic has made a £400,000 offer for former Rangers and Liverpool defender Danny Wilson. They are also confident of keeping Virgil van Dijk and John Denayer on loan. Hearts’ good financial health means they have no need to sell Wilson.

Livingston stake on Alloa Athletic in the final of the Petrofac Cup on Sunday. Midfielder Darren Cole is in mourning after the recent death of his cousin Shaun, who died in Miami from a suspected hit-and-run. Livingston boss Mark Burchill believes that Cole can overcome his heartbreak to play for his side against Alloa.
Livingston boss Mark Burchill is confident midfielder Darren Cole will play in Sunday's Petrofac Cup final despite the tragic death of his cousin in a freak accident.

Michael Weyman and Ryan Bailey's sudden departures left huge void. Dane Tilse is to sign a two-and-a-half-year contract with Hull KR. He joins former Canberra Raiders team-mate Terry Campese at Robins.

Hull KR has hired an experienced Australian forward Dane Tilse from Canberra Raiders to replace the loss of their football manager Jamie Peacock. Tilse will join Hull KR as soon as he receives the necessary paperwork from the Canberra Raiders. He is a like-for-like replacement for Weyman, who announced his retirement due to personal reasons last month.

Police found 20 grams of marijuana buried within a leg of lamb. Northern Territory Police made find after officers smelled something suspicious. The stash is believed to be worth $2000 - $100 per gram - because it was to be sold in remote communities in the Australian Outback. Police said they will continue to crack down on sale of illegal drugs.

Police in the Northern Territory discovered a new way of transporting drugs when they found a leg of lamb stuffed with 20 grams of marijuana. The lamb was being shipped to a company at Darwin Airport before being sent to the Tiwi Islands. The sender of the package is probably feeling sheepish because the drugs were discovered during an autopsy. The stash was worth $2000, a high price due to the seasoning of illegal nature. Police vow to continue targeting illegal substances in remote communities.

Liverpool beat Manchester United 1-0 in the FA Cup fifth round in 2006. Alan Smith suffered a broken leg and a dislocated ankle during the game. Reports claimed Liverpool fans attacked the ambulance with Smith in.
Alan Smith has denied that Liverpool fans attacked the ambulance he was travelling in after suffering a broken ankle nine years ago during a game against Manchester United.

ASU linebacker Davon Durant, 19, was arrested last month after he allegedly hit his girlfriend of 18 months in the face and choked her. Kelsi Langley, 19, posted his bail and recanted her story to police the next day. Witness called 911 on the day of alleged attack saying he had seen a man hit a woman in a car. Durant pleaded not guilty to aggravated assault and disorderly conduct, and has been suspended indefinitely from the team. Langley later claimed she got angry with Durant and lied to police. Said finger marks on her neck were hickeys and her eyes were red from crying, not bruised. The female ASU student and a civil rights activist accused police of making Durant out to be a thug.

ASU football player Davon Durant was falsely accused of hitting and choking his girlfriend Kelsi Langley after an argument over other girls. Langley recanted her story and revealed she lied about the assault because she was jealous. The police and media were blamed for falsely portraying Durant as a thug, and Langley insisted Durant never laid a finger on her. Despite this, Durant was suspended indefinitely from the football team and could be expelled.

Detroit Tigers pitcher Justin Verlander snapped a selfie in front of an unsuspecting little boy wearing the player's shirt in line at a Starbucks. Verlander uploaded the photo to Instagram saying the fan was 'pretty surprised' when he turned around. The photo has gotten more than 16,000 'likes' and 600 comments.

A little boy wearing Justin Verlander's shirt was surprised when he met the Detroit Tigers pitcher at Starbucks and had his picture uploaded to the player's Instagram account, which has more than 150,000 followers. The photo has received over 16,000 'likes' and 600 comments.

Chelsea flop Kevin de Bruyne has been linked with Bayern Munch. The Belgian is touted has a possible replacement for Franck Ribery. Ribery said De Bruyne's is 'great' but the wrong style of player. He said Chelsea star Eden Hazard's attributes would suit Bayern.

Bayern Munich are considering Kevin de Bruyne as a possible replacement for Franck Ribery and Arjen Robben. However, Ribery believes that De Bruyne's playing style does not fit with that of Bayern's coach Pep Guardiola. Ribery would prefer to have Chelsea's Eden Hazard on the team but knows it would be expensive. Manchester City and Paris Saint-Germain are also interested in De Bruyne.

Eden Hazard was substituted 62 minutes into Belgium's win in Israel. Manager Marc Wilmots said he believed Hazard looked to be tiring. Chelsea playmaker questioned the decision but admitted he could be tired. READ: Chelsea star Hazard rated Europe's best midfielder. CLICK HERE for the latest Chelsea news.

Chelsea superstar Eden Hazard is feeling the pressure of his hectic schedule as he makes way for his Premier League duty. He was substituted by Belgium manager Marc Wilmots with 28 minutes to go due to fatigue in their recent game against Israel. His absence was felt as captain Vincent Kompany was sent off for a second yellow card just two minutes after Hazard's withdrawal. Despite questioning Wilmots' decision, Hazard himself admitted that he has played many games this season and may be tired. Hazard won't have time for an extended rest as he returns to Premier League action with the visit of Stoke City to Stamford Bridge on Saturday.

Clarke Carlisle reveals he has 'moved out of the marital home' in Yorkshire. Father-of-three says both hand his wife have to focus on their 'well-being' The former Premier League defender, 35, tried to kill himself in December.

Former football star Clarke Carlisle has separated from his wife and has chosen to focus on his well-being following his failed suicide attempt. After moving out of his marital home in Yorkshire, he revealed in an interview that he has been struggling with depression, and that he was a "people-pleaser" who wanted to make his wife happy by masking his feelings. Carlisle was involved in a near-fatal crash after jumping in front of a truck in December 2014. Despite this traumatizing incident, the ex-Burnley defender has used the scars he sustained as a reminder of his good fortune in surviving.

Cesc Fabregas' poor form continued for Spain against Holland on Tuesday. Chelsea midfielder captained his country but they lost 2-0 in Amsterdam. If his form goes on he will not match Premier League assists record. Thierry Henry's mark of 20 in 2002-03 is four more than Fabregas' total. A resurgence in his form could help his club wrap up the Premier League. Fabregas: I am going through a great moment at Chelsea. CLICK HERE for all the latest Chelsea news.

Cesc Fabregas' slump in form for Chelsea has continued as he struggled to make an impact during Spain's 2-0 defeat by Holland. Fabregas faces a tough challenge in matching Thierry Henry's Premier League assists record of 20 as his form has dipped since Christmas. Despite playing a key role at the start of the season, Fabregas' fatigue from playing almost every minute of every match is taking a toll on him. However, with six opponents left to play whom he has previously opened up with his passing ability, Fabregas could still play a crucial role in helping Chelsea wrap up the title.
Paul Merson had questioned England selection of Andros Townsend. Tottenham winger scored equaliser in Tuesday's 1-1 draw with Italy. Merson admitted Townsend had proved him wrong with 'great goal'

Andros Townsend's performance in the England friendly against Italy caused controversy and backlash after former Arsenal legend Paul Merson accused the winger of not deserving an England call-up. Despite his poor form, Townsend managed to score a stunning goal in the match, which was a huge surprise to everyone. Merson was quick to retract his statement and praised the Tottenham player for his performance.

Michael McIndoe lured players into scheme with promise of 20% return. Ex player lived a millionaire's lifestyle and known as 'Mr Big' in Marbella. But was declared bankrupt in October last year with more than £2m debts. The 35-year-old is now being chased through the courts by creditors.

Michael McIndoe, once known as 'Mr Big' in Marbella, was a wealthy former footballer who partied with glamorous models. However, he lost all his money in a risky investment scheme that he started, leaving him bankrupt and surviving on handouts. McIndoe had once spent £40,000 on champagne in one day and had gambled away more than a million dollars. Now, creditors are demanding answers on where their money went, and McIndoe has no property or money left.
Britons spend an average of £62 a week on treats, a new study claims. Rewards range from bar of chocolate to glass of wine to pair of shoes.

The lavish lifestyles of Britons never cease to amaze us, with men leading the way in splurging on luxurious designer items, according to a study by VoucherCodes.co.uk. Spending an average of £153 within 24 hours of payday, 10% of workers are known to spend over £500 on flashy items such as high fashion clothing and accessories. The city of Swansea is leading the charge when it comes to living the high life, with 44% of its residents immediately splurging as soon as they receive their paychecks.

Five men and one woman were arrested at 8am in the port's departure zone. The group, all in their 20s, are currently being questioned at police station. Searches taking place at a number of addresses in Birmingham, West Mids. Suspects are not a family group and were not accompanied by children.

Six potential terrorists attempting to enter Syria have been arrested in Dover this morning. The arrests were part of an ongoing investigation and the individuals are currently being questioned in the West Midlands. The suspects did not pose an immediate threat to public safety.

The black pooch was filmed in action as he took a rescue rope out to his owner at the Clarence J. Brown Dam and Reservoir in Ohio on Saturday. Footage shows the unidentified man then being hauled to shore by firefighters after spending almost two hours in cold waters.

A man in Ohio was saved by his dog who acted fast by rescuing his owner with a rope after he got stuck in waist-deep mud while retrieving some duck hunting gear. The man was unharmed and remained in good spirits throughout the ordeal.

Charlie Austin revealed that Joey Barton ignored him on his first day. The pair are good friends now following the hilarious incident. The 25-year-old says QPR can't afford to lose in their double header. Austin is delighted and humbled to be fourth in the goalscoring charts. CLICK HERE for all the latest Queens Park Rangers news.

Charlie Austin has been dubbed the next Harry Kane after scoring an impressive 15 goals in his first Premier League season for QPR. He credits his success to his close friendship with Joey Barton, who famously ignored him on his first day at the club. Despite the setback, the two have become inseparable and are often seen out to dinner together with their respective partners. QPR is facing a tough couple of games against West Brom and Aston Villa, but Austin is confident they can pick up at least four points. He hopes to continue his impressive goal-scoring streak and climb up the charts, even surpassing Aguero and Costa.

FA chairman Greg Dyke wants to increase the minimum homegrown players in a Premier League squad of 25 from eight to 12. Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger has criticised the proposal. Wenger has had his fair share of dud buys for the Gunners. Perhaps he should pay attention to building a core of homegrown players. CLICK HERE for the latest Premier League news.

Arsene Wenger has been praised for his intelligent comments on the issue of English mediocrity in football. He argues that competition should be structured to favour the best and not protect the mediocre. However, his transfer record shows that he has signed a number of subpar players from abroad to save the Premier League from English mediocrity. Nonetheless, FA chairman Greg Dyke's proposal to increase the number of homegrown players in a squad may not be the solution. With the majority of the best players in the world coming from Spain and South America, English clubs will have to work harder to create the best players if they want to become the best in the world.

The terrifying video was captured in Wangaratta, northeast Victoria. A man sprays insect repellent under the handle door of his Holden Ute. He cowers back in fear when the huntsman drops out and onto the road.

A man in Victoria was attacked by a rare and venomous spider that had been living inside his car door handle. The man narrowly escaped the deadly encounter after bravely spraying insect repellent and fending off the spider. The video has since gone viral, with viewers expressing shock and horror at the man's close call.

Souths hooker Issac Luke has become embroiled in a social media storm. The 27-year-old had posted a heartfelt appeal to find a young injured fan. But he was taunted by Bulldog fans on Instagram over his posts. He lashed out at them, calling them 'lil poofters' on Saturday. The offensive comment prompted an immediate social media backlash. The post was immediately deleted and Luke has since apologised. The Rabbitohs star is now under investigation by the NRL integrity unit. It comes after Souths sealed a bitter win over the Bulldogs on Friday.

South Sydney Rabbitohs hooker Issac Luke has been accused of making homophobic comments towards fans of rival team Canterbury Bulldogs on social media. The 27-year-old lashed out at the fans after they taunted him about a young fan who was allegedly attacked at a recent match. Luke's comments were quickly deleted and he has since apologized. Many of his fans have defended him, saying that the comments were taken out of context. The NRL has launched an investigation into the matter.

The depiction is so unflattering a Facebook page called 'We Love Lucy! Get Rid of this Statue' has attracted more than 600 likes. It would cost an estimated $8,000 to $10,000 for the statue to be recast. Artist Dave Poulin has refused to comment on the controversy.

The hideous statue of Lucille Ball, which costs $8,000 to $10,000 to fix, is so scary at night that it has caused Celoron residents to tremble in fear. There is a Facebook page called 'We Love Lucy! Get Rid of this Statue' that is demanding for the statue's removal. Dave Poulin, the artist of the statue, is not an expert in sculpting and his mistake cost him the opportunity to create a stunning artwork.
Norwich move up to third spot with away victory against Brighton. Bradley Johnson struck in the 62nd minute to hand his side crucial win. Brighton remain in 16th position with six league games to go.

Norwich secured their spot in the Barclays Premier League promotion race as they defeated Brighton in a tightly-fought encounter. The match took place in persistent drizzle at The Amex and the move that sealed the win took around 10 seconds. Bradley Johnson fired a low cross by Nathan Redmond into the net, with his natural acceleration helping him outpace Joe Bennett. The impressive win helped elevate Norwich to their favourite position, with Chris Hughton left frustrated by the result.

James Oliver, 48, was left with a serious leg injury after being allegedly hit by a car driven by Linda Currier, 53. Police found Oliver in the driveway of a home in  Maine, on Saturday night. Currier arrested operating under the influence and aggravated assault. Oliver  charged with attempted gross sexual assault, unlawful sexual touching and failing to comply with the sex offender registration act.

A sex offender was caught and run over by his angry girlfriend after she caught him abusing a young girl. James Oliver was seriously injured after being hit by Linda Currier's car in Maine. Currier was arrested for driving under the influence and Oliver was charged with gross sexual assault, sexual touching, and violating sex offender registration laws.

The Turin club are 14 points clear of Roma at the top of Serie A. Juventus are aiming for a fourth straight Scudetto title. The Bianconeri are on for a potential treble, playing in the Champions League quarter-finals and the Coppa Italia semi-finals.
Allegri hopes to win the hearts of Juventus fans with his coaching skills as the Turin team aims for their first Serie A win in four years.

Harry Kane is approaching 30 goals for the season in all competitions. Mauricio Pochettino says Kane is similar to Gabriel Batistuta. Roy Hodgson wants Kane to play for the England Under 21s in the summer.

Tottenham striker Harry Kane has scored 30 goals in his first season and has been compared by manager Mauricio Pochettino to Gabriel Batistuta. Kane will play for the England Under 21s this summer despite worries about player burnout.

Barcelona among host of clubs keen on signing Paul Pogba. But Juventus director Pavel Nedved insists he is going nowhere. Czech admitted he is pleased Juve avoided Barca in Champions League. Claims that Lionel Messi is currently enjoying 'best spell' of his career. CLICK HERE for the latest Barcelona news.

Paul Pogba is set to move to Barcelona in the next transfer window, according to Pavel Nedved. Catalans expected to break the bank to acquire the Frenchman's services. Juventus director also expressed his relief that Barcelona won't be playing in the knockout stages of the Champions League. Lionel Messi is allegedly underperforming, with Nedved stating that he's having an ordinary season.

Fiorentina goalkeeper Neto has been linked with Liverpool and Arsenal. Neto joined Firoentina from Brazilian outfit Atletico Paranaense in 2011. He is also wanted by PSG and Spanish clubs, according to his agent. CLICK HERE for the latest Liverpool news.

Liverpool and Arsenal are set to compete for the signature of Fiorentina's goalkeeper, Neto. The Brazilian's agency reveals that his future is uncertain and there are many clubs interested in him, including Real Madrid.

Video posted by YouTube user Richard Stewart showing a Porsche Cayman flying out of control. Police cited unidentified driver for the crash. Car reportedly wrecked and needed to be towed from the scene.

A 31-year-old Porsche driver in Canada lost control of his car and crashed it while speeding through a green light. The car was completely wrecked and had to be towed away, reminding everyone that not all Porsche drivers are skilled.

Ex-soldier Riki Hughes, 31, was the club secretary at Tidworth Town FC. He set up fake bank account in the name of the team's landlord and siphoned off at least £17,000. Jailed for 16 months after spending the cash on camping gear and holiday.

Riki Hughes, a former soldier, has been sentenced to jail for stealing £26,000 from a children's football club where he volunteered as club secretary. The court heard that he spent the money on himself, including camping equipment, whilst also making false rent payments to Aspire Defence, the club's landlord.

Lee Cattermole returns from suspension for Sunderland. But Black Cats without injured defender Wes Brown through a knee injury. Knee surgery will see Massadio Haidara miss rest of the season. Steven Taylor, Paul Dummett, Cheick Tiote and Siem de Jong also out for Newcastle United ahead of Wear-Tyne derby.

Newcastle United's chances of winning the derby have been decimated due to the absence of five key players through injury and suspension. Meanwhile, Lee Cattermole's return from suspension is likely to boost Sunderland's chances of winning, with the Black Cats also enjoying a home advantage at the Stadium of Light.

Rory McIlroy heads to the Masters hoping to complete a career grand slam. Bose have released a video chronicling McIlroy's early career. The 2015 Masters kicks off at Augusta on April 9. READ: McIlroy warned Tiger Woods he would catch him after penning golf legend a letter... when he was just nine years old! CLICK HERE for all the latest news and build-up to the  Masters 2015.

Rory McIlroy has completed a career grand slam after winning the Masters tournament. A video by McIlroy's sponsor Bose chronicles his entire journey from being a young golfer to the best player in the world. The Masters were held at Augusta on April 9.

Sergio Garcia is looking to win his first PGA Tour title since 2012. The Spaniard is competing at this week's Shell Houston Open. It is the last PGA Tour event ahead of next week's Masters at Augusta.

Sergio Garcia is confident that he will win his second career grand slam title at the Shell Houston Open this week, despite the upcoming Masters at Augusta. The Spaniard is determined to break his victory drought and bring home a win.

Johnny Sexton has featured in 11 Euro knock-out games and won the lot. Racing Metro's No 10 wants to finish two-year stint in Paris with a medal. The French side face Saracens in last eight of European Champions Cup.

Johnny Sexton has played in many games for Racing Metro this year, including the European Champions Cup, but he has not been able to win a medal in any of them. Despite his success with Leinster and Ireland, Sexton's time in France has been disappointing and he is looking to make a bigger impact in his final games before returning to Dublin. Racing Metro will face Saracens in the quarter-finals, but Sexton will need to step up if he wants to leave Paris with a trophy.

Kamal criticised umpires' decision to award controversial no-ball against Rohit Sharma in India's World Cup match with Bangladesh. The Bangladeshi president alleged India had used its influence in the ICC. Governing body asked him to withdraw his statement or apologise. But Kamal confirmed his intention to step down.

Mustafa Kamal resigned as ICC president after accusing India of match fixing during the World Cup quarter-final against Bangladesh, leading to a controversial no-ball being given against Rohit Sharma. Kamal, who also heads the Bangladesh Cricket Board, was told to withdraw his statement or apologise, but instead chose to step down from his position. India has since denied any involvement in match fixing, and the ICC has launched an investigation into the matter.
Burnley host Tottenham  in the Barclays Premier League on Sunday. Sam Vokes' only goal this season came against Spurs in the FA Cup. Tottenham defender Ben Davies ready for Clarets test at Turf Moor.
Ben Davies prepares to face his Welsh teammate Sam Vokes as Tottenham travel to Burnley, with both teams fighting for survival in the Premier League.

Leicester City take on West Ham at the King Power Stadium on Saturday. Foxes boss Nigel Pearson has come under fire this season for some of his antics this season. These have included outbursts to the press and an altercation with Crystal Palace midfielder James McArthur in February. West Ham manager Sam Allardyce has defended Pearson and his record. The pair have worked together before when Pearson was part of Allardyce's coaching team at Newcastle in 2007.

Leicester City boss Nigel Pearson gets a vote of confidence from former colleague Sam Allardyce ahead of Saturday's match against West Ham. Pearson's style of management has been criticised this season, but Allardyce admires him for being his own man. Despite being under pressure, Pearson has done an unbelievable job not just at Leicester, but as a manager. West Ham scored with their two only shots on target against Leicester when they beat them 2-0 in December.

John Carver revealed he would use a whip to motivate his players. Newcastle have lost their last four matches against rivals Sunderland. Massadio Haidara has been ruled out for the rest of the campaign. Mehdi Abeid is expected to be in the squad after returning to training. CLICK HERE for all the latest Newcastle United news.

John Carver has announced he will be bringing a real whip to the Tyne-Wear derby to motivate his players. Carver is confident it will help Newcastle beat Sunderland having lost their last four matches against their rivals. Massadio Haidara being out for the season will prove to be a major obstacle for the team. Mehdi Abeid has returned to training and is expected to be included in the squad. If you’re looking for the latest Newcastle United news, CLICK HERE.

Newcastle hope to avoid third defeat in a row when they face Sunderland. Papiss Cisse has scored 11 Premier League goals this season. 10 of those have been decisive, and the Magpies would be in the relegation zone behind Sunderland without his goals.

Newcastle's struggles without Papiss Cisse continue as they face rivals Sunderland in a crucial derby. Cisse is the only reason Newcastle is still out of the relegation zone, with his 11 goals the only difference between the two sides. Without him, Newcastle would be sitting at the bottom of the table, struggling to score goals and win games.
Sunderland face Newcastle in the Tyne-Wear deerby on Sunday. Captain John O'Shea has targeted a fifth successive win over rivals. Black Cats are in danger of falling into relegation zone over Easter.

Sunderland are aiming to break a losing streak in the upcoming Tyne-Wear derby against Newcastle, and captain John O'Shea is confident that they will be able to do so due to strong team spirit and goal-scoring prowess. While Sunderland has been struggling lately, they are hoping to create a new record of wins against a big rival.

Stoke City have lost all eight trips to Chelsea since Premier League return. Mark Hughes insists that their fruitless Stamford Bridge visits must end. Chelsea unbeaten in 14 Premier League home games this season (11 wins)

Stoke City is confident that their winning streak on the road will continue when they face off against Chelsea at Stamford Bridge. Despite their history of defeats at the stadium, Stoke City manager Mark Hughes is optimistic that his side has the ability and focus to claim the win against the league leaders. Chelsea have not been in the best of forms lately, and Stoke City is looking to take advantage of this by capitalizing on their excellent away form to add three points to their tally at the weekend. Despite the absence of their on-loan winger Victor Moses, Stoke City is expected to welcome back Marc Muniesa from injury, as they look to extend their unbeaten run away from home.

Lee Cattermole will return from suspension to face rivals Newcastle United. Sunderland midfielder has missed the Black Cats last two matches. But, manager Dick Advocaat insists the midfielder will face Newcastle. However, defender Wes Brown will miss the derby match through injury.

Sunderland midfielder Lee Cattermole is set to miss the derby match against Newcastle United due to suspension, however, Manager Dick Advocaat is confident that the team will perform well without him. Sunderland defender Wes Brown is also ruled out due to a serious knee injury.

UEFA have confirmed a significant hike in Champions League prize money. Celtic could earn £16million just from competing in the group stages. Manager Ronny Deila is eager to secure a fourth straight title for Celtic.

Celtic are guaranteed a huge cash prize if they win the Premiership and qualify for the Champions League under manager Ronny Deila. Despite already earning £12.6m in the past, UEFA's increase in prize money for the competition could see Celtic win over £20m. Deila is aware of the pressure this brings, but believes his team is ready for it. He also sees the experience of playing in the Champions League as a significant benefit to the club. However, other Scottish teams are not happy about this arrangement and want to see more competition within the league.
Barcelona set to travel to Celta Vigo for  clash on Sunday. Lionel Messi set to return from foot injury for La Liga match. Celta forward Nolito urges former team-mate Messi not to play.
Celta Vigo forward Nolito has taunted Lionel Messi, urging him to go to the beach instead of playing in the upcoming clash against Barcelona, despite his recovery from a foot injury.
Steve Thompson suspended by Leeds just 19 games in to No 2 role. Speculation mounting over future of manager Neil Redfearn. Leeds are 13th in the Championship with 52 points.

Leeds United's Neil Redfearn is considering his future after assistant manager Steve Thompson was unexpectedly suspended. The club's president Massimo Cellino is suspended, putting additional pressure on Redfearn as the team struggles to maintain its 13th place standing in the league. Thompson's suspension has left many wondering about the details of his suspension and what will become of the struggling team.
