Hearts have already secured promotion to the Scottish top flight. Robbie Neilson believes it is inevitable clubs will come in for his players. He insists he will only sell them if it is the right move for the club. Hearts play Rangers on Sunday and could help their rivals Hibernian.

Robbie Neilson has confirmed that Hearts might have to let go of their best players to make way for new ones. However, he won't sell anyone unless it is the right move for the club. Hearts will be facing off against Rangers on Sunday and it might prove to be a challenging match for the recently promoted side.

Rangers winger David Templeton is full of praise for the impact of new boss Stuart McCall. He feels that the new regime is far better than that under Ally McCoist and Kenny McDowall. Templeton has singled out a new-found intensity and more astute tactics as reasons behind the recent upturn in fortunes at Ibrox. Rangers go into Saturday's game with Championship title-winners Hearts off the back of two consecutive wins.

Former Rangers boss Ally McCoist and caretaker manager Kenny McDowall have been criticized by David Templeton for their substandard training methods and lack of tactical preparation. Templeton praised the arrival of new boss Stuart McCall, who has brought a new intensity to the team along with astute tactics. Rangers will play Hearts on Saturday after two consecutive wins under McCall's leadership.

West Ham manager Sam Allardyce has warned Brendan Rodgers that any bumper deal offered to Raheem Sterling could upset other Liverpool players. Sterling has recently rejected terms of £100,000 per week at the Anfield club. The England international is widely regarded as one of the best young talents this country has to offer. Speaking ahead of West Ham's game with Leicester, Allardyce also took time to defend under-fire Foxes boss Nigel Pearson. Pearson was part of Allardyce's coaching staff when he managed Newcastle.

Sam Allardyce has warned Brendan Rodgers that giving a bumper new contract to Raheem Sterling could lead to other Liverpool players leaving the club. The West Ham manager is convinced that Sterling's huge salary could trigger a series of departures from the Anfield club. Allardyce claims that top talents like Sterling are in such high demand worldwide that football clubs are willing to pay whatever it takes to keep hold of them. Speaking ahead of West Ham's match with Leicester, Allardyce praised Leicester manager Nigel Pearson, who was once his coach at Newcastle.

Newcastle United travel to Sunderland on Sunday in Tyne-Wear derby. Gutierrez has appeared as substitute in three games since return from testicular cancer, but hasn't yet been on winning side. Argentine wants to make amends after four straight losses to rivals.

Newcastle United midfielder Jonas Gutierrez, who recently returned from testicular cancer, is determined to lead his team to victory against Sunderland in an upcoming game. Despite being a substitute for the last three games, Gutierrez's presence on the pitch has been well-received by both fans and team members. While Sunderland is currently struggling in the Barclays Premier League, Gutierrez believes that this is no indication of the outcome of the derby. He thinks that it doesn't matter what position either team is in, because a derby is a derby, and anything can happen. Newcastle United has lost the last four consecutive games against Sunderland, but Gutierrez is hoping to turn it around this time.

Thomas Piermayr has been training with the Championship club this week. Blackpool sit bottom of the table and are set to be in League One next year. Piermayr is a free agent and had been playing for Colorado Rapids.
Blackpool looks set to sign Obafemi Martins' former teammate, Thomas Piermayr, to hopefully turn their losing streak around.

Theo Walcott's contract with Arsenal expires at the end of next season. England winger has made just five starts for his club this campaign. Ian Wright says it would be 'a shame' to see Walcott leave Arsenal. The Gunners have been linked to signing Liverpool's Raheem Sterling.

Ian Wright is disappointed about Arsene Wenger's refusal to play Theo Walcott as a striker, which has caused his lack of game time at Arsenal. Wright believes that Walcott should have been moved into a central role like Thierry Henry, but Wenger has only briefly experimented with the idea. Walcott's contract is due to expire soon, and Arsenal have shown interest in signing Raheem Sterling from Liverpool.

Raheem Sterling has revealed he is not ready to sign a new Liverpool deal. The Reds wideman has struggled to repeat last season's impressive form. The 20-year-old Liverpool star has managed just six goals this  season. READ: Sterling insists he is not a 'money-grabbing 20-year-old' Sterling: What he said about contract talks... and what he meant. CLICK HERE for the latest Liverpool news.

Raheem Sterling, one of Liverpool's star players, has turned down a new £100,000-a-week contract after revealing in a BBC interview that he would have signed for even less a year ago. Despite displaying impressive form last season, he has failed to maintain his performance, scoring just six goals this season, which is even less than Stoke frontman Jon Walters.
England needed to beat France in their final Euro 2015 qualifier. But goals from Sehrou Guirassy and Gnaly Cornet won it for the hosts. Late response from Fulham's Patrick Roberts wasn't enough.

England's Young Lions failed to qualify for the Under 19 European Championships after being defeated by France in their final qualifier. Despite a goal from Roberts, France's Cornet and Guirassy took the lead and won the game for the hosts.
Ross Barkley impressed during England's 1-1 draw against Italy. Roberto Martinez hopes Barkley can kick on for Everton. Everton face Premier League clash against Southampton on Saturday.

Ross Barkley has been the standout player for Everton this season, impressing with his technical ability and physicality. He is now set to lead the team against Southampton in their upcoming Premier League clash. Despite his impressive performances, Barkley's inclusion in England's World Cup team last summer seems to have affected his form this season. However, Roberto Martinez believes that Barkley is ready to bounce back and become an even more influential player for Everton and England.
West Brom finished 10th and 8th under Roy Hodgson and Steve Clarke. The Baggies finished 17th in last season's Premier League. Tony Pulis wants to do extensive business in the summer market.

West Bromwich Albion manager Tony Pulis is expected to make major changes to the team once they secure their Premier League safety. Pulis wants to bring in new players such as Wolves winger Bakary Sako and Neil Taylor to help get the club back on track and become a top-ten team.

Kevin Sinfield has announced he is leaving Leeds at the end of the season. The 34-year-old will cross codes to join sister club Yorkshire Carnegie. Former England captain has won six Super League titles with the Rhinos.

Leeds Rhinos' captain Kevin Sinfield will face a lot of challenges when he makes his move to rugby union. Despite his outstanding performance and leadership in rugby league, there are doubts whether he can achieve the same success in his new sport. Sinfield will also have to deal with being a marked man, which may affect his performance.

South Sydney secured a bitter 18-17 victory after a last-gasp penalty. Bulldogs were leading until the referee awarded Rabbitohs a late penalty. Rabbitohs converted the penalty and went on to win the game. As officials made their way off the field, they were pelted with missiles. One of the officials was taken to hospital with suspected broken shoulder. Canterbury coach has apologised for the actions of his club's supporters. Bulldogs CEO said the club has called for a life ban on fans involved. Police have identified two people for allegedly throwing bottles. Inquiries to identify others involved in the attack are continuing.

Violent rugby fans in Sydney have attacked officials on the field of a match between South Sydney and Canterbury, hurling plastic water bottles and abuse. The incident follows the referee's decision to award South Sydney a late penalty resulting in their 18-17 victory over Bulldogs. In the aftermath, officials have suffered injuries and hospital visits. Canterbury coach Des Hasler has apologised on behalf of the club and Bulldogs CEO called for a life ban on fans involved. The police are investigating the case and have identified two people for throwing the missiles.

A short film highlights the nasty things people say about the homeless. People who sleep rough in Toronto read tweets people made about them. They include: 'I hate when it's cold because the homeless get on the bus'

Toronto homeless people have been recorded reading out tweets about their lives, causing an outpouring of sympathy and donations to the charity "Humans For Humans". One homeless man has spent 47 years living outside, but he's aware his story is not unique.

Brighton giving young players training in law surrounding sexual consent. The Seagulls are the first to provide counselling to youth players. Part of training involves taking part in question and answer sessions.

Brighton and Hove Albion are making strides in preventing sexual assault by providing counselling to youth players. The club has successfully trained young players to understand the nuances of consent and also provides confidential question and answer sessions to discuss past experiences. The four players accused of sexual assault in 2013 were found guilty after going through the PIP program.

Burnley winger George Boyd has run the furthest in the Premier League. His 210.5 miles this season beats Christian Eriksen from Tottenham. Burnley have run an incredible 2,172.3 miles between them this season. Players from Stoke, Hull, Liverpool and West Ham feature in the top 10.

George Boyd from Burnley has run an incredible 210.5 miles during the Premier League season, beating the closest runner by 0.4 miles. Burnley also had the most runners in the top 10 list, along with other teams outside of the top half. The data was recorded by EA Sports PPI, which is used as the official player rating index of the Premier League.

Manchester United flop Anderson was sent off for Internacional this week. Anderson saw red for an off-the-ball shove during the first half of 1-1 draw. Team-mate Fabricio stole the limelight by swearing at his own fans.
Anderson's mistakes were overshadowed by his teammate Fabricio's red card after flipping off fans in a match where both players were caught in a brawl.

Sterling's talks with Liverpool over new deal have ended in stalemate. England star, 20, insists he is not a 'money grabber' after turning down £100,000-a-week contract offer tabled by Liverpool. PFA boss Taylor says resuming talks in the summer is a wise move. The rise of Raheem Sterling: From £60 a day at QPR to knocking back £100,000-per-week contracts at Liverpool. Liverpool FC press conference: As Raheem Sterling hints at possible exit, find out what Brendan Rodgers has to say. CLICK HERE for all the latest Liverpool news.

Raheem Sterling has rejected an incredible £100,000-a-week contract offer from Liverpool and is considering moving to Arsenal or Spanish clubs. Talks have stalled due to his refusal to sign a new deal. Sterling is not loyal to Liverpool and is being criticized for postponing contract negotiations until the summer. PFA boss Taylor believes that Sterling's actions are those of a "money grabber".
Police say baby had breathing problems and died yesterday afternoon. Her father, 25, and her mother, 22, arrested in Perry Barr, Birmingham.
A five-month-old baby from Perry Barr, Birmingham was found dead yesterday afternoon due to a severe beating by her father and mother; both have been arrested on suspicion of murder.

Dug and owner Lindsay Castro were hiking in Fontana, Canada. Lindsay heard a rattle sound and backed away but Dug ran toward it. Snake jumped out, bit him, his face swelled to twice its size. After two days of intensive antidote treatment, he is going home.

Dug the pug was bitten by a rattlesnake while hiking and miraculously survived. His owner rushed him to the hospital where he was given two vials of venom antidote and treated for a week. The two are now back at home and enjoying their hikes again.

Youths took boy to an isolated place in Padma Nagar, India, and raped him. When he resisted, they set him on fire, leaving him with 30 per cent burns. He is now being treated at the Thane Civil hospital, about 30 minutes away.

A six-year-old boy was attacked by two teenagers and set on fire in Padma Nagar, Mumbai. The police are still investigating the incident, but a case has already been registered under relevant sections of Indian Penal Code.
Harvey Boulter revealed former defence secretary took a friend abroad. He is now giving money to the opposition of Tom Tugendhat.
Tory candidate Tom Tugendhat faces opposition from businessman Harvey Boulter due to a libel case involving Liam Fox.

Jose Mourinho left Real Madrid in 2013 after a series of public fall-outs. But Alvaro Arbeloa says he could see The Special One returning to Real. He credits Mourinho as the 'foundation' of Champions League success. Arbeloa says his spell ended well but Chelsea boss is happy in London. Mourinho is said to be on good terms with £40m target Raphael Varane.

Real Madrid defender Alvaro Arbeloa has claimed Jose Mourinho could make a shock return to manage the Spanish giants. Mourinho's exit in 2013 was mired in controversy, but Arbeloa insisted the door was always open for the Chelsea boss. Arbeloa said he could see no reason why Mourinho would not return to Madrid, adding that Mourinho's work laid the foundation for their Champions League success. The pair is said to be on good terms, despite a series of public fall-outs with senior players. Mourinho is said to be eyeing up an audacious £40m move for Raphael Varane when the transfer window opens.
Paddy Morrall noticed image after wood was left in rain for several hours. 31-year-old said he was not normally a religious guy but it was Easter.
A builder was stunned to find the son of God's image on a plank of wood in Scotland just days before Easter, following similar sightings in hot cross buns and dental x-rays across the UK and Arizona.

BBC paid for research into how smiley faces could be used in news stories. Licence fee payers' money was spent on the 'ridiculous' 44-page document. Designers told to make emojis of Gary Lineker and Graham Norton's faces.
BBC staff caused outrage over the inappropriate use of emojis in news stories after misinterpreting people's emotions.

Inter Milan held 1-1 by bottom-of-the-table Parma in Serie A on Saturday. Roberto Mancini cancels players' day off after criticising attitude. Inter Milan players will now report for training early on Easter Sunday.

Inter Milan players were scolded by their furious coach Roberto Mancini after their lackluster performance against Parma. The players were called in for a morning training session on Easter Sunday as punishment for their behavior during the game.

Liverpool were beaten 4-1 by Arsenal at the Emirates on Saturday. Club's top four hopes have been dealt a massive blow with the defeat. Liverpool lost to another of their top-four rivals Manchester United before the international break. Brendan Rodgers admits that their chances of qualifying for next season's Champions League have severely diminished.

Liverpool’s defeat against Arsenal on Saturday was an expected result given that they had lost their last seven matches against top-four sides. The club and their manager, Brendan Rodgers, have accepted that it won’t be possible for them to finish in the top four after the defeat. They are now focused on the FA Cup quarter-final replay against Blackburn. Despite the loss, Liverpool is still moving in the right direction under Rodgers as they are continuing to improve and recruit new talent.

Paul Parker played for Manchester United, QPR and Fulham among others. The right back also made 19 international appearances for England. Parker's expired passport was listed for sale on eBay for £5,000.
Paul Parker's expired passport, which dates back to his playing days in Chelsea and Manchester United, was sold for a whopping £10,000 through online bidding.

Martin Skrtel caught Daniel Kolar in the face with a raised boot. Slovakia continued their good recent form thanks to Ondrej Duda's goal. It was third win over Czech Republic since break-up of Czechoslovakia.

Slovakia defeated the Czech Republic in a friendly match on Tuesday, with Jan Kozak's men looking dominant throughout. Liverpool defender Martin Skrtel scored the winning goal with an impressive header, while young midfielder Ondrej Duda shone with his movement and passing. The Slovakians continue to impress in Euro 2016 qualifying and look set to make waves in the tournament proper.
Karim Benzema has scored 20 goals in all competitions this season. Real Madrid face Granada in a crucial La Liga clash on Sunday. Benzema is targeting a Ballon d'Or award in the near future.

Real Madrid's Karim Benzema recently showed off his impressive rapping skills while cruising around in his luxury Bugatti Veyron. The French footballer is confident in his abilities and believes he can win the Ballon d'Or award, despite the two-year winning streak of Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi. With his impressive goal tally of 20 in all competitions this season, Benzema is eager to help Real Madrid achieve a victory over Granada in their upcoming La Liga clash.
Substitute Ishmael Miller scores 89th-minute equaliser for Huddersfield. Sergiu Bus had put Sheffield Wednesday ahead three minutes earlier.

Sheffield Wednesday defeated Huddersfield 1-0 in a tightly contested game, with Sergiu Bus scoring the only goal of the match in the 86th minute. The Huddersfield team failed to create any significant scoring chances, giving Wednesday an easy win.

Stuart Dallas, 23, was playing for Crusaders just three years ago. After a tough start to life at Brentford, he was loaned out to Northampton. Since returning to Brentford, he has become a star in promotion push.

Stuart Dallas, former park footballer, scored two stunning goals in Brentford's 4-1 victory over Fulham and is now on track for a Premier League promotion. He owes his success to a maligned loan system and his loan spell at Northampton.

Three adults taken to hospital after head on collision at Frenchs Forest. The crash was between a Toyota Klugger and E-Type Jaguar. Nobody was injured in the crash and it is being investigated. It comes after police warned motorists to obey road rules over Easter.

A vintage E-Type Jaguar worth over $120,000 was completely written off after a collision with a Toyota Kluger in Frenchs Forest over Easter weekend. Car enthusiasts expressed sympathy for the owner of the rare car on social media. Police are investigating the circumstances surrounding the accident. Extra police were on duty during the long weekend to curb reckless driving.

Trey Moses, a Kentucky high school student who has committed to Ball State next year, surprised Ellie Meredith during her P.E. class on Thursday. He asked her to prom with flowers and a sign reading: 'Let's Party Like it's 1989' - a reference to an album by Taylor Swift, Ellie's favorite singer. She accepted and is now looking forward to going dress shopping. Moses works with teenagers with developmental disabilities through a volunteer program in Louisville.

A high school student surprised a girl with Down syndrome by asking her to prom. Trey Moses, who currently attends Ball State, asked Ellie Meredith with a sign referencing an album by her favorite singer, Taylor Swift. She accepted and is now anticipating dress shopping. Moses volunteers with teenagers with learning disabilities.

Villagers in Shangdong are seen using bags as long as six metres. It is becoming a common behaviour in some villages since 2011. Previous investigation suggested gas in the bag are often stolen. Gas carriers have little understanding of dangers claiming it to be safe.

Villagers in Shangdong Province are transporting natural gas in large plastic bags on rickshaws, a safe and cheap way to save money on gas transportation. This practise has been welcomed by locals who claim it is not dangerous at all and have been doing it for years.

A new Facebook graph reveals the favorite baseball teams in the country by sorting through people's likes and breaking down winners by county. The New York Yankees and Boston Red Sox, who come in first and second respectively in terms of the number of fans. The New York Mets and Oakland Athletics did not win one single county.

Even though baseball has been America's favorite pastime, the New York Yankees and Boston Red Sox are not as popular as Texas Rangers and Atlanta Braves, who have fans across the South, according to a new Facebook graph that reveals the favorite baseball teams in the country by sorting through people's likes and breaking down winners by county. It also shows the New York Mets and Oakland Athletics winning some counties, with the Toronto Blue Jays claiming almost all of Canada.
President spoke to the camera for 12 seconds, beginning in southern drawl. Obama has previously said he is a fan of the show and its ruthless efficiency.

President Obama acted as Frank Underwood for April Fool's Day, showing his appreciation for the ruthlessly efficient behavior of the character from House of Cards. The clip was filmed as part of the YouTube series West Wing Week, where the President had the chance to demonstrate his best southern drawl.

Brady Eaves, 18, was filmed biting the head off a live hamster at a party. He is the stepson of John Arthur Eaves Jr, Democratic candidate for Mississippi governor in 2007, now an esteemed pro-life lawyer. The teenager is a University of Mississippi scholar, Phi Delta Theta frat member, star soccer player, was a top student at private school in Jackson. Sources told DailyMail.com he is an 'animal lover' with a pet raccoon. They said Eaves and his friends fed the hamster vodka and 'hot-boxed' its cage with marijuana before the sickening stunt was caught on camera. Eaves could be charged with felony animal cruelty charges if it was filmed in Florida, where there is 5-year maximum jail term and $5,000 fine.

Brady Eaves, a student of Mississippi, has been expelled from his college and fraternity as well as been submitted for mental assessment after a viral video surfaced of him biting the head off a live hamster. He could be charged with felony animal cruelty charges, which carry a maximum jail term of five years and $5,000 in fines. His stepfather John Arthur Eaves Jr, the Democratic candidate in Mississippi's 2007 gubernatorial elections, and mother Angel Eaves said that they have withdrawn him from college and will assess him professionally. Eaves, who is an animal lover with a pet raccoon, feed vodka to the hamster before committing the act.

John Bramblitt developed epilepsy aged 11 and went blind when he was 30. After going blind, Bramblitt began creating the most amazing artworks. Some of his art features scenes and people he has never seen before. Despite being blind, his art is highly accurate and incredibly vibrant.

John Bramblitt lost his sight after developing epilepsy aged 11. He is known for creating incredibly vibrant and highly accurate artwork despite going blind. His art features scenes and people he has never seen before, but he is able to paint them through a special technique using tactile senses.

Silhan Ozcelik, 18, went missing from Kurdish family’s home last October. Court heard she travelled on Eurostar to Stuttgart, home of Kurdish Workers' Party youth movement. Ozcelik, from Clissold Park, north London, charged with one terror offence.

A Kurdish teenager has been arrested for plotting a terrorist attack in Germany. She was detained at Stansted Airport and has been charged with one count of engaging in preparation for terrorist activity. The hearing was met with protest outside the courthouse.

Caykur Rizespor lost to Fenerbahce in the Turkish Super Lig on Saturday. Rizespor midfielder Ludovic Obraniak was substituted after just 30 minutes. Obraniak was taken to hospital for tests on suspected heart problem. Former Lille player was reported to be in a stable condition.

Ludovic Obraniak, a midfielder playing for Fenerbahce in the Turkish Super Lig, suffered a heart attack during his team's match against Caykur Rizespor on Saturday. The 30-year-old former Lille player was taken to the hospital, where doctors pronounced him dead on arrival.

Chris Ramsey praises Tony Pulis as one of the best coaches in Britain. The Queens Park Rangers boss says he won't be asking for his advice. QPR travel to West Brom on Saturday in crucial relegation clash. CLICK HERE for all the latest QPR news.

Tony Pulis is known for his highly successful long-ball tactics which Chris Ramsey praised ahead of their match on Saturday. Ramsey believes that Pulis is one of the top British coaches in the country and hopes to incorporate his tactics into his own team's play. QPR are currently in a dire position, and Ramsey knows that listening to advice and learning from successful coaches like Pulis is crucial for their survival in the Premier League.

Curacao have advanced to the second qualifying round for 2018 World Cup. Patrick Kluivert's side won 4-3 on aggregate to set up match against Cuba. Curacao will face Cuba in next round on June 8 and 16.
Patrick Kluivert led his team of under 21 internationals to a victory against Montserrat, pushing Curacao closer to World Cup qualification.

Tiger Woods increased speculation regarding possible Major comeback. Woods has been spotted at Augusta National on more than once occasion. The 39-year-old has dropped out of top 100 for first time in almost 19 years.

Tiger Woods has confirmed his attendance at the Masters tournament after being seen practising at Augusta National. Woods has won the Masters four times but has not played the event since missing it last year due to back surgery. Despite being out of form, he has been determined to return to his previous standard of play and his practice sessions may be an indication that he is ready to compete again at the highest level.
Dougie Fife, Alasdair Dickinson and Ross Ford return for Edinburgh. Trio were rested following Scotland Six Nations campaign. Edinburgh face London Irish in European Challenge Cup quarter-final.

Edinburgh is ready to face London Irish in the European Challenge Cup quarter-final with their best players, including its captain Ross Ford. The trio of Dougie Fife, Alasdair Dickinson, and Ross Ford will give everything they have to take the team to victory following their successful run with Scotland in RBS Six Nations.

Kumar Sangakkara retired from one-day cricket after the World Cup. Sri Lanka were defeated in the quarter finals by South Africa. Sports minister Navin Dissanayake has asked the Test captain to play on for another year.

Kumar Sangakkara has been asked by the Sri Lankan sports minister to come out of retirement and play for the country for another year despite his decision to retire from cricket after the World Cup in March. Navin Dissanayake asked him to remain involved in the sport while appointing a new interim body to run the game headed by Sidath Wettimuny.

Moses Kipsiro says five female athletes came to him for help. He alerted his federation and police to the allegations. The Commonwealth champion has since received death threats. Kipsiro may have to leave Uganda as he wants to protect his family. He has passed details of the death threats to officers in Kampala, Uganda. Kipsiro, along with Mo Farah, is represented by Pace Sports Management.

Mo Farah's training partner, Moses Kipsiro, has been receiving death threats after alerting Ugandan authorities to allegations of sexual abuse of young female athletes. Despite his national titles and world medals, Kipsiro has been dropped from the team and may have to leave Uganda to protect his family.
Crystal Palace host Manchester City on Monday Night Football. Eagles boss Alan Pardew refuses to write off City's title chances. Palace have no new injury concerns ahead of the Selhurst Park clash.
Manchester City has been predicted to win the Premier League title by Crystal Palace manager Alan Pardew ahead of their Monday Night Football against Crystal Palace.

Jefferson Montero to have fitness test after picking up injury with Ecuador. Tom Carroll ruled out for Swansea after damaging ankle ligaments. Mohamed Diame and James Chester to return following long lay-offs. Gaston Ramirez also set to play a role despite carrying slight knock.

Swansea City will be playing against Hull City this weekend in a highly anticipated Premier League match. Swansea is expected to put in a strong performance with all their key players fully fit and ready to go. With their home ground advantage, they are the clear favorites to win the match.

Hull's Steve Bruce has revealed the club have reapplied for name change. The FA blocked previous attempt for club to become Hull Tigers. Previous attempt to change name by owner Assem Allam angered fans.

The Hull City Tigers continue to face opposition from the Football Association as their request for a name change has been blocked for a second time. Fans have expressed their anger over the failed attempts to change the team name, but owner Assem Allam remains resolute in his plans to make it happen. Despite the arbitration panel ruling against the name change, the Tigers are moving forward with the rebranding process.

Decorated former Argentina international Esteban Cambiasso says that keeping Leicester up this season would be like 'another cup' The former Inter Milan and Real Madrid midfielder joined Leicester last summer on a free transfer, signing a one-year deal. Leicester are currently bottom of the Premier League table with 19 points from 29 games and take on West Ham in their next fixture.
Esteban Cambiasso is confident that Leicester City have a good chance of making an immediate return to the second tier of English football.

Toby Alderweireld has impressed during season-long loan at Southampton. Ronald Koeman's side are challenging for Champions League places. But Atletico Madrid says they are counting on Alderweireld for next season. Sporting director Jose Luis Perez Caminero praises Belgian defender.

Belgian defender Toby Alderweireld will leave Southampton and join Tottenham next season, despite impressing on the South Coast. Atletico Madrid sporting director Jose Luis Perez Caminero says Alderweireld will not return to La Liga, but will instead move to Spurs for a permanent transfer.

Diego Costa to be given late fitness test following hamstring injury. John Obi Mikel will not be included despite recovering from knee injury. Jon Walters expected to shake off a calk knock for Stoke City. Marc Muniesa expected back after five games out with hamstring problem.

Chelsea is gearing towards its game against Stoke City this weekend, with Diego Costa likely to make an appearance despite suffering from a persistent hamstring injury. Meanwhile, Jon Walters, who is recovering from a calf injury, is set to make a comeback for Stoke City. However, Chelsea will not be able to include Victor Moses in the game as he is on on-loan to Stoke City.

Swansea have lost all three games after an international break this season. Set to host Hull City in the Premier League on Saturday afternoon. Garry Monk's side have been in the top 10 for the entire campaign so far.

Swansea have struggled to pick up points after international breaks this season, but Garry Monk is confident they can turn it around against Hull on Saturday. The team has exceeded expectations by consistently staying in the top 10 and are only five points away from beating their best ever Premier League points total. Despite tough matches against Chelsea, Stoke, and Manchester City after previous international breaks, Monk believes his team has just been unlucky. They are looking for a double against relegation-threatened Hull and are in good form heading into the crucial end of the season.

Celtic extend their lead at the top of the Scottish Premiership table. James Forrest scored the opener for the visitors before Stefan Johansen made sure of three points from the penalty spot. St Mirren remain bottom of the league table with 21 points.

St Mirren almost managed to steal a win against Celtic on Friday night, but ultimately lost 2-1 after an excellent goal from James Forrest and a penalty from Stefan Johansen. Despite St Mirren's efforts, Celtic extended their lead at the top of the Scottish Premiership.

Rangers have been beaten three times by Edinburgh clubs at Ibrox thisseason. Manager Stuart McCall wants victory over Championship winners Hearts. Rangers defeated Edinburgh Hibernian at Easter Road recently.

Rangers have been struggling this season, particularly in their home ground Ibrox where they have been repeatedly beaten by the Edinburgh clubs. However, the recent victory over Edinburgh Hibernian at Easter Road could be the turning point they need to beat the Championship winners Hearts. Manager Stuart McCall is confident that his team is good enough to go toe-to-toe with Hearts and get a morale-boosting victory for their fans. He also believes that togetherness and a good work ethic are key to success, and Rangers are on the right track to achieving that.

Ex-Brazil striker Ronaldo is a co-owner of Fort Lauderdale Strikers. Ronaldo insists the club will target signing the best players in the world. Ronaldo believes the lifestyle in the United States appeals to top players.

Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo are set to join forces and play for second-tier US team, Fort Lauderdale Strikers, thanks to the dedication of club co-owner and former Brazil striker Ronaldo. The team is on track to become a global force with Ronaldo announcing his willingness to pay out of his own pocket to secure the world's top talent. The lifestyle of South Florida is also a huge drawcard, attracting famous players from around the world.

Carlos Tevez and Roberto Pereyra scored as Juventus defeated Empoli. They had goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon to thank for making several saves. Roma strengthened their grip on second place thanks to  win over Napoli. Alessandro Diamanti and Mohamed Salah's earned Fiorentina victory.

Juventus have practically won the Serie A title after beating Empoli 2-0. Roma are in second place after their 1-0 win over Napoli. AC Milan won their first away game since October by beating Palermo 2-1.

Mohamed Salah scores as Fiorentina beat Sampdoria 2-0 in Serie A. On loan Chelsea winger scores second as his side go fourth. Roma beat Napoli 1-0 for first home win in four months. Carlos Tevez strikes as Juventus maintain huge lead at the top.

A thunderous free kick from Carlos Tevez helped Juventus beat AC Milan 2-1, maintaining their 14-point lead at the top of the Serie A. Meanwhile, Fiorentina rose to fourth place with a 2-0 win over Sampdoria, thanks to goals from Alessandro Diamanti and Mohamed Salah. Roma secured their first home victory in over four months with a 1-0 win over Napoli, with Miralem Pjanic scoring the goal. Furthermore, Jeremy Menez out-ran two defenders and delivered an unstoppable shot, securing the victory for AC Milan over Palermo. Inter Milan were denied their first win in five games in a 1-1 draw with bottom club Parma.

Chelsea are six points clear with a game in hand in the Premier League. They have led the title race since a brilliant start to the season in August. Cesar Azpilicueta feels that consistency puts them in pole position to win.

Chelsea are dominating the Premier League from the very start of the season, according to Cesar Azpilicueta. The Spanish defender has credited their top position to their impressive record since the first day of the competition. Though Chelsea have had their ups and downs in their season, they continue to lead with six points ahead of Manchester City. Azpilicueta is confident that their successful moments are enough to put them in a good position for the title.

Kevin de Bruyne has been linked with a transfer away from Wolfsburg. His agent Patrick De Koster says that clubs are watching the Belgian but denies a deal is in place with any team to buy the talented playmaker. De Bruyne has starred for the German side this season in the Bundesliga.

Kevin de Bruyne is set to join Manchester City in the summer after his agent revealed that a deal has been agreed with the Premier League club. The Belgian star has been one of the hottest prospects in European football and has impressed Manchester City's scouts with his performances for Wolfsburg.

Charles Piutau has played 14 internationals for New Zealand. Piutau can play as full back, wing or centre and will join Ulster in 2016. Ulster team manager Bryn Cunningham is excited to secure Piutau.

Ulster have announced the signing of a new international rugby player. The player has won 14 caps for New Zealand, and will be joining Ulster in 2016. He is a versatile player who can play in multiple positions on the field. The team manager of Ulster, Bryn Cunningham, expressed his excitement for the signing.

George North knocked out after scoring against Wasps on Friday. Concussion was the wing's third suffered in recent months. North will sit out Saturday's Champions Cup clash on medical advice. Wasps No 8 Nathan Hughes been banned for three weeks for the incident.

Welsh rugby player George North has been advised not to play again this season after suffering a severe head injury during a match against Wasps on Friday. Though North was unconscious for a short period of time, team officials say he is recovering quickly with no bad after-effects. Wasps No. 8 Nathan Hughes has also been banned for three weeks for his dangerous play that resulted in North's injury. North's team, the Northampton Saints, will have to compete without him in their upcoming European Champions Cup match against Clermont Auvergne, despite his previous history as the top try-scorer of the season with seven.

Hull City travel to Swansea City in Premier League on Saturday. Steve Bruce is boosted by return from injury of Mohamed Diame. The Senegalese midfielder has been out for four months with knee injury. Tigers currently have a three-point cushion to relegation zone. Owner Assem Allam has again applied to FA for Hull Tigers name change. CLICK HERE for the latest Premier League news.

Hull City's star midfielder, Mohamed Diame, is set to make his comeback from injury when the Tigers take on Swansea City in the Premier League on Saturday. Diame, who was signed for £3.5 million from West Ham, has been out for over four months with a knee injury. With just eight matches remaining, Hull will be relying on Diame to secure their Premier League status for another season. The team owner, Assem Allam, has successfully applied to have the team name changed to Hull Tigers, which has generated excitement among fans.

Swansea midfielder Tom Carroll is on a season-long loan from Tottenham. The 22-year-old has featured 18 times for the Swans this season. Carroll could be out for up to six weeks after injuring his ankle. He scored the only goal during England U21s' win against Czech Republic.
Tom Carroll is out for six weeks due to injury sustained during England Under 21s' win against the Czech Republic last Friday. Swansea will have to do without his services.
Franck Ribery hopes to be fit for next week's German cup clash. Ribery aggravated the injury picked up against Shakhtar Donetsk. Fellow winger Arjen Robben also out of the weekend's big game.

Bayern Munich winger Franck Ribery admitted his inability to play against Borussia Dortmund and ride a bike. He will miss the quarter-finals of the German Cup, but may return for the upcoming challenges with pain.

Philipp Lahm is expected to start against Dortmund at the weekend. Lahm has made two substitute appearances since his injury comeback. Franck Ribery, Arjen Robben and Javi Martinez will miss Dortmund clash. David Alaba is expected to be out for the rest of the season.

Bayern Munich's coach Pep Guardiola is worried about the fitness of several of his key players ahead of Saturday's match against Borussia Dortmund. Philipp Lahm could make his first Bundesliga start since returning from injury, but Franck Ribery, Arjen Robben, Javi Martinez, and David Alaba will all be out due to injuries. Guardiola is also unsure about Holger Badstuber's fitness, and Thiago Alcantara may only play a few minutes as he recovers from a knee injury. Bayern Munich is facing mounting injuries at a critical point in the season with seven games in the next 22 days. "The squad Bayern have put together is there to fight for all the titles. No excuses. If we don't win, it's our fault," Guardiola said.

Alvaro Morata started just three La Liga games for Real Madrid last season. 22-year-old joined Juventus in £15.8million transfer last summer. Morata has scored seven goals in 22 Serie A matches so far this campaign.

Alvaro Morata has expressed his desire to return to Real Madrid despite a successful season at Juventus. His agent, Beppe Bozzo, confirmed that talks are underway for a potential return to his former club.

The veteran Burnley defender believes Dyche could manage Three Lions. 37-year-old described his boss as 'first class' Former Northern Ireland international has played in top eight divisions. Duff himself is hoping to enter management after his retirement.

Michael Duff, defender for Burnley football club, has revealed in an interview that Sean Dyche, the current Burnley manager, has been approached by the Football Association to take charge of the England football team. Duff went on to say that Dyche is likely to accept the position as he has always had aspirations to manage at the highest level. Meanwhile, Duff is focused on leading Burnley to success in this year's Premier League and has plans to retire from professional football at the end of the season to pursue a career in acting.

Brentford beat local rivals Fulham 4-1 in the Championship. Mark Warburton's side moved up to fifth in the table with their win. The Bees boss admitted he is 'really pleased' with the result. Fulham manager Kit Symons says his team are not safe from relegation.

Brentford emerged victorious against Fulham in a thrilling contest that saw Stuart Dallas score twice and set up two more goals. The Bees, who are now fifth in the Championship table, could be on course for an automatic promotion spot after their latest win. Fulham manager Kit Symons, however, is concerned about his team's chances of avoiding relegation.

Millwall beat 10-men Charlton 2-1 in their Championship clash at the Den. Addicks defender Chris Solly was sent off for a handball in the area. Stephen Henderson saved the subsequent penalty from  Lee Gregory. Alou Diarra scored for  visitors against the run of play in the second half. Magaye Gueye levelled for the Lions before Jos Hooiveld netted late winner.

Millwall secured a 2-1 victory over Charlton in a closely fought Championship match. Charlton captain Chris Solly was one of three goal scorers, but was later sent off. Millwall's Lee Gregory missed a crucial penalty, which allowed Charlton to take the lead through Alou Diarra. However, a late equalizer from Magaye Gueye gave Millwall the chance to score a match-winning goal, which was secured by Jos Hooiveld just before the final whistle.

Over 30 Premiership and Championship games scheduled this weekend. More than half the games are set to be affected by delays and disruption. Engineering works affect routes to  London Euston, hitting west coast line. Labour say ministers have failed to learn from the Boxing Day chaos.

The Easter rail shutdown will not affect football fans travelling to any of the Premiership or Championship games this weekend, despite more than 30 games scheduled. The repair work only impacts a small number of railway lines and contingency plans have been put in place to ensure that fans can easily move around. The government has consulted with various football clubs to confirm that widespread delays and disruptions have been avoided.

Natal's Dunas Arena, which held four World Cup matches, is up for sale. Its owners are suffering from cash flow problems after a corruption scandal. The company is also selling a 50 percent share of Salvador's Fonte Nova arena, which held six matches last summer.

Brazil's football stadiums suffer from structural problems leading to their eventual closure. The Dunas Arena in Natal and Fonte Nova in Salvador are being sold by owner Grupo OAS due to corruption scandal and government austerity.
Russia won the vote to host the 2018 World Cup. US senators have asked FIFA to reconsider because of Ukraine crisis. England are planning to bid for Euro 2028 after Sepp Blatter steps down.

US senators have demanded that FIFA revoke Russia's hosting of the 2018 World Cup due to perceived moral and ethical reasons. Additionally, despite the UK's failed bid for the 2018 tournament, the nation is making its agenda known for its desire to host Euro 2028.

Striker given Maurico Pochettino's blessing to play for England Under 21s. Roy Hodgson has confirmed the Kane will be in Gareth Southgate's European Championship squad. Kane is also set to travel to Australia and Malaysia this summer ahead of the championships.
Harry Kane will be playing for the England senior team this summer after getting permission from Mauricio Pochettino, and will be traveling to both Australia and Malaysia for the tournaments.

Final Barclays Premier League live TV matches announced. Twelve matches to be shown on Sky Sports in May, three on BT Sport. Manchester United vs Arsenal moved to 4pm on Sunday, May 17. CLICK HERE for the latest Barclays Premier League news.
The final televised fixtures for the 2015-16 Barclays Premier League season have been revealed as Manchester United and Arsenal move their showdown to Sunday May 17.
Jet named The Resurrected Veteran restored by U.S. father and son team. Flown at air shows as tribute to all servicemen who have died in combat.

A pioneering U.S. father and son team restored a bomber that was used in World War Two and in the Korean War before being retired in the 1980s. Named The Resurrected Veteran, the P-51D Mustang fighter jet was constructed from over 200 parts and is flown at air shows around the country. The Yoaks say their aircraft represents a celebration of the nation's armed forces and the black paint has tiny sparkling stars, each sparkle representing an American Veteran that served the country.

Thomaz Alckmin, son of city governor Geraldo Alckmin, said to have died. He was on board when aircraft crashed in Carapicuiba area of Sao Paulo. House was apparently empty of people and said to have been unfinished. Three mechanics also thought to have died in crash at 5.20pm yesterday.

A tragic helicopter crash in Sao Paulo has claimed the lives of five people, including a close friend of Thomaz Alckmin, son of the city governor Geraldo Alckmin. Investigators are still unsure of the cause, but it is believed that the house on which the helicopter fell was carrying a shipment of dangerous chemicals.

Car first designed to help French farmers transport their sheep for sale. From humble origins the 50-year-old hatchback is popular the world over. Accounting for two thirds of cars sold in the UK it dominates most markets.

The Renault 16 was designed to transport sheep and became the world's first ever hatchback. The Americans were slow to adopt hatchbacks due to their love of gas-guzzling cars. The Ford Focus is the world's best-selling nameplate and hatchbacks are incredibly popular in India where the Maruti 800 has sold 2.66 million since 1983.

Andros Townsend an 83rd minute sub in Tottenham's draw with Burnley. He was unable to find a winner as the game ended without a goal. Townsend had clashed with Paul Merson last week over England call-up.

Paul Merson has reignited his feud with Andros Townsend by mocking him for being a late substitute in Tottenham's draw with Burnley. Townsend redeemed himself by scoring a stunning equalizer for England in their friendly against Italy. Despite this, Merson remains critical of Townsend's inclusion in the England squad.

Juan Arango has apologised for his bite on Monterrey's Jesus Zavala. Arango had earlier scored a free kick in his team's 4-3 defeat. The 34-year-old Venezuela captain has admitted he was in the wrong. He was not punished in the game but could face retrospective disciplinary action from the Mexican league authorities.

Juan Arango was caught biting one of his opponent's shoulders during a Mexican league game. The 34-year-old captain of the Tijuana club apologised to midfielder Jesus Zavala after the match, which ended with a 4-3 victory for Monterrey. There was no action taken against Arango during the game by the referee, although he could face disciplinary action. The incident was similar to Luis Suarez's bite on Giorgio Cheillini during the 2014 World Cup.

Almeria fired Juan Ignacio Martinez on Sunday after 4-1 defeat by Levante. Former Barcelona defender Juan Sergi Barjuan named as new head coach. Martinez took charge in December after Francisco Rodriguez was sacked. Almeria are 18th in La Liga with nine games left to play.
Sergi Barjuan's comeback to Barcelona was announced by Almeria as the new coach of the team.

Real Madrid beat Granada 9-1, with Cristiano Ronaldo scoring five goals. The Portuguese forward now has 36 goals this season in La Liga. That league tally is more than the totals for 53 of Europe's top 98 teams. Nine teams in the Barclays Premier League have fewer goals this season.

Cristiano Ronaldo led his team to a crushing victory against Granada with a five-goal haul, setting a new personal record. His league tally of 36 goals this season is greater than that of 98% of European teams. Additionally, Ronaldo's performance surpassed Lionel Messi's previous record of 24 La Liga trebles. Not only that, but his goalscoring feats have surpassed those of several legendary football clubs, including Borussia Dortmund, Torino, and Lille.
Ben Jones-Bishop impressed by scoring solo try against the Warriors. Jones-Bishop extended lead as Salford's leading scorer of the campaign. Both Salford and Wigan finished the match with 12 men.

Salford Red Devils managed to end their 17-game losing streak against Wigan with a sensational victory. Star player Ben Jones-Bishop, who signed up with Salford this season, scored his seventh try of the campaign, leading his club to a 24-18 victory over the Warriors. The match was marked with several altercations resulting in both teams finishing the match with only 12 players on the field. In addition, Salford's Weller Hauraki, who was already facing a ban after Friday's game at Huddersfield, and John Bateman were sent off after trading punches.
Weakened St Helens suffer another defeat against strong Hull side. Jamie Shaul scored late long-distance score to secure win. Inexperienced champions had looked like holding on until late shock.

Hull defeated St Helens in a close match, with Jamie Shaul scoring an amazing try to seal the match. The injury-hit champions put up a good fight but ultimately couldn't stop the determined Hull side.

England fans sang anti-IRA songs during Tuesday's draw with Italy. FA tried to stamp out chants after 'F*** the IRA' was sung against Scotland. Roy Hodgson's side take on the Republic of Ireland in Dublin in June.

The Irish political situation of the Sixties, Seventies and Eighties was at the center of the England-Italy friendly game in Turin, where thousands of English fans protested against the IRA with songs and chants. The Football Association released a statement condemning the behavior of some supporters and apologized for any insult generated by their chants and words, as they were heavily criticized for being unrewarding towards the loyalty of those who travel to watch England play. The game against the Republic of Ireland, set for June this year, will put Hodgson’s side to the test to prove they can sustain the peaceful and amicable nature of their traveling supporters.

England manager Roy Hodgson appears to still not know his best XI. Sportsmail's top team of reporters reveal their England Euro 2016 line-ups. England are currently top of Euro 2016 qualifying Group E on 15 points.

England manager Roy Hodgson struggles to determine his best team ahead of Euro 2016, with conflicting opinions from Sportsmail reporters. It remains to be seen whether England will be able to maintain their top spot in Euro 2016 qualifying Group E.

A man named John posted the advert in a newsagents in Muswell Hill. It details that he is looking for a companion, apprentice, worker and lover. He says the role will bring 'a way of life with quality' His ideal woman is aged between 30 and 40 and is happy to be interviewed.

A man named John is looking for a female apprentice/worker to change her life through his craft, but he has not specified what the craft is. His ad in a local newsagents window has gone viral and has led many to joke about it being similar to the start of the movie Saw.

Daniel Andersson, Helsinborg's 42-year-old kit man, kept a clean sheet. The emergency stopper played in season opener against Kalmar. Henrik Larsson's first-choice goalkeepers were both out injured. The former goalkeeper earned one cap for Sweden back in 2001.

Henrik Larsson's 42-year-old kit man, Daniel Andersson, surprised everyone by scoring the winning goal against Kalmar in the Allsvenskan season opener. The former Barcelona striker was forced to play Andersson in goal due to injuries to both of their regular goalkeepers. Despite his lack of experience, Andersson impressed everyone with his incredible display of skill and talent.

Mils Muliaina came off injured during Connacht's visit to Gloucester. The 34-year-old World Cup winner was arrested by police after the game. Muliaina was held in cells overnight and questioned by officers in Cardiff. He denies assault allegations over alleged incident last month.

World cup winning rugby star Mils Muliaina has been arrested on suspicion of sexual assault in connection with an allegation in Cardiff, but denies any involvement. He was approached by police after his team's defeat in the European Challenge Cup, and was held in custody overnight before being questioned by detectives. The incident allegedly occurred in a crowded bar in the Brewery Quarter of Cardiff city centre after his Irish team played against Cardiff Blues last month.

Good Friday commemorates the crucifixion and death of Jesus Christ. 'Way of the Cross' walks took place in Ohio, Pennsylvania, Los Angeles and over the Brooklyn Bridge, among others. Just a few of the events that were taking place all over the world at Holy Week nears its end. Tens of thousands of people flocked to Pope Francis' Good Friday procession at the Colosseum in Rome.

Christians all over the world took part in various festivities to mark Easter Sunday. Among the numerous events that were organized were 'Way of the Cross' walks which were held in cities such as Ohio, Pennsylvania, Los Angeles and New York City. People celebrated this holiday by carrying wooden crosses and participating in religious reenactments of the crucifixion. In addition, Pope Francis led a Good Friday procession at the Colosseum in Rome with thousands of followers in attendance.

Marouane Chamakh, Fraizer Campbell and Jordon Mutch ruled out. Suspended Crystal Palace  skipper Mile Jedinak joins them on the sidelines. Yaya Toure back from an achilles injury for Manchester City. James Milner expected to be available for champions despite knee trouble.

Crystal Palace will play Manchester City with both teams expected to perform at their best. Yaya Toure has returned from international duty to join his team for the game, while Marouane Chamakh, Fraizer Campbell, and Jordon Mutch will be enjoying the match from the sidelines. The other key player, Manchester City's James Milner, is expected to make a full recovery from his recent knee injury.

Arsenal midfielder Abou Diaby's contract runs out at the end of the season. He had been expected to leave after 22 appearances across five seasons. But Wenger has hinted a sign of progress could see him earn a new deal. READ: Diaby gets a game in friendly win over Brentford. CLICK HERE for all the latest Arsenal news.

Abou Diaby's future at Arsenal remains uncertain after Wenger has not yet decided to offer him a new contract despite his injury troubles. However, Diaby's amazing resilience may have convinced the club to sign him to a multi-year deal.

Raheem Sterling, Jordan Henderson and Steven Gerrard are Liverpool's top scorers in the Premier League this season with six goals each. Seventeen of 20 Premier League clubs have top scorers with more goals. Liverpool are paying for failing to properly replace goals of Luis Suarez.
Liverpool's poor attack this season can be attributed to the poor form of Raheem Sterling, Jordan Henderson and Steven Gerrard, who have only scored six goals each.

Alan Pardew was warned about his behaviour following touchline spat. The former Newcastle boss called Manuel Pellegrini a 'f***ing old c**t' He wrote to Pellegrini to apologise for using such offensive language. Crystal Palace host Manchester City at Selhurst Park on Monday.

Alan Pardew has received extensive training to handle on-field situations ahead of Crystal Palace's face-off against Manchester City. The former Newcastle manager was required to go through sessions with a sports psychologist Jeremy Snape, to suppress his natural aggression in a bid to avoid controversy. Pardew was reprimanded after calling Pellegrini an expletive in a past game, leading to an apology which was well received by the Manchester City boss, who is now under severe pressure to improve results. In preparation for the game, Pellegrini has admitted that he is in urgent need of a new big player, although it is difficult to achieve this considering the weight of expectations on top clubs every two years.

Manchester City are currently nine points behind league leaders Chelsea. City face Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park on Monday evening. Joe Hart has said his side will not give up on retaining the title.

Despite being nine points behind league leaders Chelsea, Manchester City goalkeeper Joe Hart is confident that his team still have a chance at winning the Premier League title. Hart, who recently won his 50th cap, is known for his optimism and leadership qualities. He also looks up to Italian goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon, whom he considers a legend of the game. Although Hart admits he cannot emulate Buffon's style, he still hopes to improve his game and continue as the first-choice goalkeeper for both Manchester City and England.

A kangaroo has been found hopping through a field in Bruhl, Germany. German police initially believed the report was an April Fools day prank. After realising the caller was serious they found the beast in a nearby field. The owners later called police when the animal returned to it's enclosure. It is suspected that the it's fencing was damaged after severe storms.

A kangaroo has escaped from a German circus and was found happily hopping through fields in Bruhl, Germany. Police initially dismissed the report as a joke until they discovered the animal in a nearby field. The circus owners were contacted and claimed to have accounted for all their kangaroos. However, the escaped kangaroo was later found in its enclosure after it was lured back with food. The circus has been fined for breaching animal welfare laws.

Channel 7 were left red faced after letting a rude name appear on screen. A donation for $32.38 earned Hugh. G Rection some screen time. Twitter users were quick to identify the on-screen blunder. The telethon appeal for the Royal Children's Hospital saw a record breaking number of donations.

Channel 7's controversial airing of the Good Friday Appeal has been met with outrage on social media after a philanthropist named Hugh G. Rection was shown donating a suspicious amount of $32.38 on air. Many took to Twitter to express their anger and disgust at the inappropriate display. The Royal Children's Hospital should be ashamed to have accepted such a donation.

QPR beat West Brom 4-1 away from home on Saturday in bid to beat drop. Club remain 19th in the Premier League but are three points from safety. Chris Ramsey's side face Aston Villa in crunch match on Tuesday. QPR manager says his players have belief that they can stay up.

QPR are flying high after a 4-1 away victory against Aston Villa in the Premier League. After ending their five-game losing streak, they now look to continue their good form in their match against Chelsea on Sunday. QPR manager Chris Ramsey is confident his team can get a result in both matches.

Alan Hutton, Scott Sinclair and Ashley Westwood ruled out for Aston Villa. Philippe Senderos & Kieran Richardson among doubts for Tim Sherwood. Yun Suk-young and Eduardo Vargas absent for Queens Park Rangers. Richard Dunne, Leroy Fer and Alejandro Faurlin also missing for QPR. Two sides clash at Loftus Road on Tuesday at 7.45pm.

Aston Villa's Tim Sherwood will be without his top three players, while QPR's Eduardo Vargas and Yun Suk-young are out through injury. QPR will also be missing Richard Dunne, Leroy Fer, and Alejandro Faurlin for the match against Aston Villa. The clash will take place at Villa Park on Tuesday at 7.45pm.
Kim Sei-young leads ANA Inspiration by three after a three-under-par 69. The South Korean says it would be 'the biggest dream' to win. Lydia Ko struggled again, shooting a two-over-par 74.

Kim Sei-young dominated day three of the ANA Inspiration in California, taking a three-shot lead into the final round with a score of three-under-par 69. Lydia Ko was unable to repeat her first-round performance when she equaled Annika Sorenstam's record, and struggled with a two-over-par 74.

Lydia Ko shot her second straight over-par round in the ANA inspiration. New Zealander Ko shot a 2-over 74 on Saturday in disappointing round. Ko made an 8-foot birdie putt on the par-5 hole to keep long streak going. She has had at least one birdie in all 187 of her rounds in 49 career events.

Lydia Ko broke the LPGA Tour record by shooting a 2-over 74 on Saturday in the ANA inspiration. Despite the disappointing round, she continued to impress with an impressive birdie streak of 187 consecutive birdies in 49 career events.

Tiger Woods has confirmed he will compete in the upcoming Masters. Woods goes into the Masters after plummeting to 104 in world rankings. Colin Montgomerie believes it is important for Woods to impress.
Colin Montgomerie hopes Tiger Woods will be able to compete at the Masters and defeat Rory McIlroy to win his fifth championship but fears he may have to drop out due to a recurring back injury.

Record numbers have flocked to see local boy Jordan Spieth in action. Spieth and Phil Mickelson have been gearing up for the Masters. Texas-born Spieth quit university in order to concentrate on golf career.

Jordan Spieth and Phil Mickelson wow crowds at the Shell Houston Open, with Spieth's impressive rounds lifting him to within striking distance of the lead. Despite criticism for giving up on university to join the PGA Tour, Spieth has risen to number four in the world rankings. Mickelson has also impressed with his play leading up to the Masters. Englishmen Justin Rose and Paul Casey are also in the mix.
Lydia Ko is seven shots behind leader Kim Sei-young. Ko had been aiming for a 30th consecutive under-par round. But the world No 1 could only finish on one-over par.

Lydia Ko fell short of breaking her own record for most consecutive under-par rounds in the LPGA Tour, but she managed to hold her own with a respectable one-over par finish. Meanwhile, Kim Sei-young took the lead after carding a spectacular eagle on the last hole.

Serena Williams progresses to semi-finals after beating Sabine Lisicki. Williams beats German in three sets at Miami Open - 7-6, 1-6, 6-3. World No 1 presented with cake after 700th career victory. Andy Murray was similarly given reward after 500th career win.

Serena Williams celebrated National Cake Week with a giant cake after making it into the Miami Open semi-finals. The world No 1 claimed her 700th career victory with a win over Sabine Lisicki, while Andy Murray was also presented with a cake after his 500th career win. Williams hopes of playing sister Venus were dashed as she lost to Spain's Carla Suarez Navarro. Williams will face Simona Halep in the semi-finals after Halep defeated Sloane Stephens.

Aljaz Bedene officially became a British citizen at a ceremony on Tuesday. The 25-year-old is currently ranked No 83 in the world but will be GB No 2. Andy Murray says fellow British players like James Ward and Kyle Edmund should not complain about the assimilation. Bedene was born in Slovenia and could rise up the rankings, says Murray. British No 1 insists young stars should use Bedene as motivation.

Andy Murray urges British tennis players to not be bothered by the arrival of Aljaz Bedene into the home ranks. Bedene, who was originally from Slovenia before becoming a British citizen, currently ranks at No. 83 in the world, but he could rise up the rankings in the future. Murray suggests that players like James Ward and Kyle Edmund should use the assimilation of Bedene as a motivator to improve their game. Finally, Murray also adds that Bedene has recently become a spokesperson for a popular Slovenian sports drink company.

British No 1 defeated Dominic Thiem in Miami Open quarter finals. Andy Murray celebrated his 500th career win in the previous round. Third seed will play the winner of Tomas Berdych and Juan Monaco in the semi finals of the ATP Masters 1000 event in Key Biscayne.

Andy Murray emerged as the winner in the Miami Open despite facing stiff competition from Austrian player, Dominic Thiem. With his 500th career win in the previous round, the British tennis star is all set to take on a strong contender in the semi-finals of the ATP Masters 1000 event in Key Biscayne. Murray’s fiancee, Kim Sears, was seen scintillating in the stands.

Carla Suarez Navarro beat Venus Williams in the Miami Open quarter-finals. The Spaniard fought back from a first-set bagel to win 0-6, 6-1, 75. German No 9 seed Andrea Petkovic beat Karolina Pliskova 6-4, 6-2. CLICK HERE for all the latest from the Miami Open.

Carla Suarez Navarro causes a shocking upset by beating Venus Williams in the Miami Open quarter-finals. Williams struggled with injuries during the match and was unable to compete with the Spaniard's skillful gameplay. Petkovic also had an easy win against Pliskova, securing a spot in the semi-finals. Serena Williams and Simona Halep are expected to have an easy time in their respective quarter-finals matches. Find updates on the Miami Open here.

Novak Djokovic came from a set down to beat Alexandr Dolgopolov. The world No 1 remains in contention for his fifth Miami Open win. Dolgopolov became less mobile after receiving treatment to his feet. Djokovic faces David Ferrer next after Spaniard beat Gilles Simon. Andy Murray through after beating South Africa's Kevin Anderson.

Novak Djokovic defeated Alexandr Dolgopolov to easily clinch a quarter-final spot at the Miami Open. Dolgopolov suffered from foot problems and was no match for Djokovic. The Serbian is on track for his fifth Miami Open win and will face Kevin Anderson next. David Ferrer also progressed to the quarter-finals after securing an effortless victory against Gilles Simon. Meanwhile, Andy Murray advanced to the quarter-finals after demolishing his opposition with stellar plays.
Nick Scholfield is lined up to ride Spring Heeled in the Grand National. The famous race takes place at Aintree on April 11. Scholfield travels to Ireland to sit on Spring Heeled on Friday.

Nick Scholfield confirms he will ride Spring Heeled in the Grand National at Aintree. The race takes place on April 11 and Scholfield is expected to have a good chance at winning after his success in last year's event.

Newport Gwent Dragons scored tries through Hallam Amos and Nic Cudd along with a penalty try. Cardiff replied with scores from Lloyd Williams, Gareth Anscombe and number eight Josh Navidi. Wales captain Sam Warburton was in action for the Blues.

The Newport Gwent Dragons had a tough game against the Cardiff Blues, with both teams showing brilliant attacking skills. Ultimately, the Dragons had the upper hand, with two tries and multiple conversions by Tom Prydie and Dorian Jones, leading to a narrow victory over the Blues. Sam Warburton played a crucial role in both teams, but ultimately his efforts were not enough to secure a win for the visitors.
Bath's England contingent return for Champions Cup quarter-final. Premiership side face Leinster at the Aviva Stadium on Saturday. Quartet will be seeking to make amends for Six Nations defeat.

Bath's quartet of England players, led by fly-half George Ford, seek revenge against Leinster in Dublin after being thrashed 19-9 in the Six Nations. Bath's head coach, Mike Ford, believes that the loss in the international tournament will benefit them in the Champions Cup quarter-final. Leinster, however, will be keen to keep their English rivals under control with lions prop Cian Healy, No 8 Jamie Heaslip, full-back Rob Kearney and flanker Sean O'Brien set to dominate the field.
Alfonso Thomas to coach in Indian Premier League this month. Veteran Somerset bowler has agreed a deal with the Delhi Daredevils. 2015 edition of Indian Premier League to begin on April 8.

Somerset's legendary cricketer, Alfonso Thomas, has been signed by the Delhi Daredevils for the entirety of the Indian Premier League. Although he is recovering from a broken ankle, Thomas is determined to lead Delhi Daredevils to victory this season.

Moeen Ali picked up side injury during England's dismal World Cup. Injury meant all-rounder was not considered for squad to tour West Indies. But Moeen is hoping to join up with the squad later in the tour.

Moeen Ali, the off-spinning all-rounder for England, has fully recovered from his side injury and is set to join the squad for the entire West Indies tour. Despite missing out on the World Cup campaign, Ali is expected to play a significant role in England's success in the Caribbean.

Sim Bhullar is set to sign a 10-day contract with the Sacramento Kings. The 22-year-old will become the NBA's first player of Indian descent. Bhullar will be on the roster when the Kings host New Orleans Pelicans.

The Sacramento Kings' newest signing, Indian-born Sim Bhullar, is set to break NBA history due to his 7-foot-5, 360-pound impressive physique. He will officially join the Kings when they host the New Orleans Pelicans.

Arsenal maintained they superb run of form by thumping Liverpool. Arsene Wenger's side moved into second place following the 4-1 victory. Wenger believes everyone can 'smell' what is happening at the Emirates. However, French manager is refusing to get complacent with their form.

Arsene Wenger is thrilled with his team's recent success, with Mesut Ozil's impressive free-kick and Alexis Sanchez's rocket securing a comfortable 4-1 victory over Chelsea. Wenger was pleased with the team's mentality and cohesion, stating that "there is finally something happening at Arsenal again." He is confident that they can give anyone a run for their money and is determined to catch up with leaders Chelsea.

Michel Vorm's Tottenham chances have been few since Swansea transfer. But Vorm is set to cover for injured Hugo Lloris against Burnley. Manager Mauricio Pochettino has praised Vorm's attitude and character.

Michel Vorm, the former Swansea goalkeeper, is set to take over Hugo Lloris' position as Tottenham's main shot-stopper after Lloris suffered a knee injury in the 4-3 victory over Leicester in the Premier League. Manager Mauricio Pochettino has described Vorm as an "able deputy" who has demonstrated strength of character and a good attitude. Tottenham will face Burnley on Sunday and Pochettino is confident of his team's form, having lost only one match in the last four Premier League games.

Celtic beat St Mirren 2-0  in their Scottish Premiership clash on Good Friday. Leigh Griffiths was named among the Celtic substitutes for the match. Striker was caught eating a biscuit during the first 10 minutes of the match.

Leigh Griffiths indulges in a strict diet of biscuits to maintain his form during matches. The player was caught on camera during the Celtic's 2-0 win over St. Mirren happily snacking on a Tunnock's Tea Cake. His coach, Ronnie Deila, encouraged players to stick to a strict diet but Griffiths' unconventional diet might be the key to his football success.

Stuart McCall is trying to lead Rangers to Championship promotion. He is confident that the club's removal from the London Stock Exchange this week won't derail their hopes of going up. Rangers this week announced six-month losses of £2.6million. McCall was surprised at the news Rangers will have to hand Newcastle £500,000 if they are promoted to the Scottish Premiership.

Rangers boss Stuart McCall is confident about leading his team back into the top-flight despite the club's financial struggles, including six-month losses of £2.6million. The recent decision to remove the club off the London Stock Exchange caused a stir among fans, but McCall remains positive about their promotion push. The news that if Rangers win promotion they will have to hand Newcastle United £500,000 came as a shock to McCall, who admitted he was not aware of the deal. However, he remains focused on the game against Hearts and is planning to give the newly-crowned Scottish Championship winners a guard of honour.

Newcastle travel to the Stadium of Light to face Sunderland  on Sunday. Clash being billed as 'The Desperation Derby' with both sides struggling. John Carver is fighting to secure his future as manager beyond the season. Carver has stopped thinking about getting the job on a permanent basis. Dick Advocaat is striving to ensure Sunderland remain in Premier League.

Fans of Newcastle and Sunderland can look forward to an exciting game in the 'Donkey Derby' on Sunday. Both teams are in great form and have scored a combined total of four times in their last 18 hours of football. John Carver is confident about his future as Newcastle manager, while Dick Advocaat's reputation is on the line for Sunderland. Fans can expect a potentially poisonous atmosphere with Jack Colback and Adam Johnson returning to their former clubs.

Danilo this week agreed to join Real Madrid in the summer for £23million. Transfer will take total raised from player sales to £440m since 2004. James Rodriguez, Pepe and Radamel Falcao among those sold by Porto. CLICK HERE for all the latest Real Madrid news.

Porto have earned over £400million in player sales in the past decade, primarily thanks to their successful formula of buying South Americans for low prices and selling them to wealthy European teams for huge profits. Danilo is the latest star to leave, signing with Real Madrid for £23m, following in the footsteps of James Rodriguez and Radamel Falcao. Despite this, Porto have maintained their success on the field, reaching the Champions League quarter-finals and winning multiple league titles. The club's success is set to continue, with Arsenal rumored to be interested in signing Colombian striker Jackson Martinez.

Lionel Messi faces tests on Thursday to see if he will be fit for Barcelona. Argentine star missed both games for his country with a swollen foot. Chelsea and Manchester City could be keen on Valencia's Jose Luis Gaya. Real Madrid's signing of Danilo shows an intention to gamble on the future. L'Equipe speculates that Radamel Falcao could return to play for Monaco.

Lionel Messi's injury has caused him to miss both of Argentina's games during the international break, and he is now facing tests to determine if he will be able to play against Celta Vigo on Sunday. Manchester City and Chelsea are said to be interested in Valencia's Jose Luis Gaya. Real Madrid is taking a gamble with their signing of Danilo. L'Equipe speculates that Radamel Falcao could return to play for Barcelona.

River Plate admit they 'dream' of Manchester United striker Radamel Falcao. The Colombia international spent eight years with the Argentine club. Falcao has managed just four goals in 19 Premier League appearances. READ: Falcao still 'has faith' that he could continue at Man Utd next season. CLICK HERE for the latest Manchester United news.

River Plate are confident of securing the return of their former forward Radamel Falcao from Manchester United. Despite the complications, the Argentine club is widely expected to re-sign the Colombia international as he has a great scoring record for his former club. Despite a quiet season with Man Utd, Falcao is still considered to be one of the best strikers in the game and is expected to make a big impact in the Argentine league.

Stephen Curry scored 27 points against the Clippers to help his side to win. Klay Thompson also played key role in Golden State Warriors' victory. Eastern Conference leaders Atlanta Hawks were beaten by Detroit.

Golden State Warriors' Stephen Curry and Klay Thompson helped secure a victory over the Los Angeles Clippers in a close game. The Eastern Conference leaders, the Atlanta Hawks, also fell to defeat against Detroit. San Antonio Spurs guard Tony Parker scored 16 points in his 1,000th NBA game against the Miami Heat.

Brendan Rodgers failed to make it as a professional footballer. Rodgers left Northern Ireland at the age of 16 to prove himself at Reading. The Liverpool boss was forced to quit playing by the age of 20. 42-year-old believes past experiences have inspired him to look after Liverpool's young stars.

Liverpool boss Brendan Rodgers has been motivated by his failed career as a professional footballer to nurture young talent such as Raheem Sterling and Jordan Ibe. Rodgers, who left Northern Ireland for Reading at 16, failed to live up to the promise of a first team spot and had to quit playing at just 20 years of age. However, he has used this experience to prepare and give opportunities to young players.

Liverpool manager said Raheem Sterling is 'going nowhere' this summer. Brendan Rodgers said club are a 'superpower' and don't have to sell stars. Sterling in relaxed mood as Liverpool trained on Thursday morning. England star joked with Daniel Sturridge and shook hands with Rodgers. Sterling said on TV he is not ready to sign a £100,000-a-week contract. Rodgers said the BBC interview took everyone at club by surprise. Contract talks look set to be dragged out to the summer. Sterling admitted in interview he is 'flattered' by interest from Arsenal.

Raheem Sterling, Liverpool's top player, has recently admitted on television that he is not yet ready to sign his massive £100,000-a-week contract. This has fueled rumors that he may be leaving Anfield this summer.
