Jonas Gutierrez was an unexpected inclusion, but performed well. Dick Advocaat continued Sunderland's new managers' winning tradition. John Carver left Jack Colback exposed to Sunderland hate at left back.

Cancer survivor Jonas Gutierrez stars in defeat for Newcastle, as Dick Advocaat records a historic win in his second Sunderland game. Sunderland and Newcastle unite to pay tribute to the victims of the MH17 tragedy.

Craig Dawson to serve ban following Gareth McAuley's incorrect red card. WBA keeper Ben Foster ruled out for six months with knee injury. QPR have no fresh injury concerns with Richard Dunne and Leroy Fer out. Queens Park Rangers teenager Darnell Furlong also ruled out.

West Brom and QPR will battle it out this weekend, but West Brom's Craig Dawson will be sitting out due to a controversial red card. Meanwhile, QPR will miss the presence of Mauro Zarate and Richard Dunne, but are otherwise healthy.

West Ham are currently top of the Fair Play rankings in the Premier League. Should they finish there at the end of the season, they could qualify for the Europa League next term. Sam Allardyce is well aware of the benefits of being able to offer European football to players in the transfer market. Allardyce led Bolton Wanderers to UEFA Cup qualification in 2005.

West Ham manager Sam Allardyce is hoping to secure team qualification for the Europa League through UEFA's Respect and Fair Play rankings. The Premier League team is sitting third in the rankings and could secure European qualification regardless of their league position. Allardyce believes that the journey of playing in Europe will be a great experience for the team, and may even help in the recruitment of players.

Lee McCulloch was shown a straight red card after fouling Osman Sow. Rangers went on to win Scottish Championship fixture 2-1 at Ibrox. Stuart McCall says captain McCulloch apologised to both him and the players after sending off against Hearts.

Rangers fans celebrated a 2-1 victory against Hearts after Lee McCulloch apologized for his behavior during the match. McCulloch was shown a red card for sleeping on Osman Sow but the team managed to hold on to their lead to win the Scottish Championship fixture at Ibrox.

David Templeton endured injury-induced frustration during time at Hearts. But, Rangers winger insists he will show no envy towards them on Sunday. Templeton will form part of a celebratory guard of honour if he starts clash. The winger made his first start in almost three months last weekend.

David Templeton is looking forward to facing off against his former team, Hearts, in his up-and-coming match. The injured star is set to put his recent negative feelings to the side as he applauds the opposition on the Ibrox pitch this weekend.

Real Madrid thrashed Granada 9-1 in La Liga at home on Sunday. For the first time since November Real have all seven attacking stars fit. Fiorentina host  Juventus in Coppa Italia semi-final second leg on Tuesday.

Real Madrid is facing a difficult problem with seven players competing for six spots, which may cause some hurt feelings. Also, Inter Milan is experiencing a divide between Italian and foreign staff, and Juventus is preparing to employ star striker Carlos Tevez alongside Alvaro Morata for the Coppa Italia semi-final.

Real Madrid take on Granada in La Liga early Sunday kick-off. Carlo Ancelotti's side four points off Barcelona in the title race. Real were beaten 2-1 in El Clasico last time out before international break.

Real Madrid thrash Granada with a brilliant 9-1 win in La Liga. Cristiano Ronaldo scores five goals, including a hat-trick in seven minutes, as the home team easily demolish their opponents. The game was a must-win for Real after their El Clasico defeat to Barcelona last time out.

Nabil Fekir and Alexandre Lacazette scored in Lyon's 3-1 win at Guingamp. Lille got back to winning ways with a 3-1 triumph over strugglers Reims. Modibo Maiga's hat-trick earned Metz a 3-2 win over Toulouse. Nice and Evian both picked up another point in their battles for survival. Paris Saint-Germain face Marseille in Le Classique on Sunday night.

Lyon moved to the top of Ligue 1 with two quick-fire second-half penalties in their 3-1 win at Guingamp. Lille got back to winning ways with a 3-1 triumph over Reims. Metz gave themselves hope of staying up as Modibo Maiga scored a hat-trick in their 3-2 victory over Toulouse. Nice and Evian shared points in their battles for survival. Paris Saint-Germain struggle against Marseille in Le Classique on Sunday.

Roma win at home for the first time since November. Miralem Pjanic completes a counter-attack to put hosts ahead. Morgan de Sanctis produces stunning goalkeeping display. Napoli without a win for five matches after terrible run.

Roma secures a crucial victory against Napoli, with Miralem Pjanic scoring an incredible goal. Morgan de Sanctis proves his worth as a goalkeeper and helps Roma secure a comfortable lead, with no chance for Napoli to recover. The win gives Roma hope in its pursuit for a Champions League spot.

Borussia Dortmund host Bayern Munich on Saturday at Signal Iduna Park. Teams contest Germany's biggest domestic game, Der Klassiker. But little is riding on it with Bayern Munich cruising to Bundesliga title. Dortmund hope home win will keep them in shout of Europa League spot.

Bayern Munich and Borussia Dortmund are set to clash in a highly anticipated football match. Der Klassiker has lost some of its historical relevance due to the teams being nine places apart in the German league. Dortmund have experienced a terrible season and they hope to salvage their season with a top six finish. Bayern Munich is set to win the Bundesliga title for the third time in a row, but the match may dent their lead a bit more. Dortmund is in a good position to beat Bayern because of winger Franck Ribery, who has a recurring ankle problem, joining Arjen Robben and David Alaba on the sidelines.

Torpedo Moscow fans broke down barriers and threw seats. Match suspended for seven minutes. Torpedo went on to win 3-1. Torpedo punished three times this season for racist behaviour from fans. Russian Premier League have promised a 'harsh punishment'

Violent clashes between Torpedo Moscow and Arsenal Tula fans caused the suspension of the match for seven minutes, resulting in Torpedo's victory. Torpedo Moscow are infamous for their hooliganism and racist behaviour, resulting in multiple punishments for their supporters throughout the season.

Robin van Persie ruled out with ankle injury for Manchester United. Chris Smalling a doubt but Luke Shaw back from hamstring complaint. Ron Vlaar could make return to Aston Villa squad following calf injury. Joe Cole and Jores Okore have also regained fitness for Villans.

Manchester United's Luke Shaw recovers from a serious leg injury and will be playing against Aston Villa at Old Trafford. Ron Vlaar returns from his knee injury and is expected to make a huge impact on the match. Robin van Persie and Chris Smalling are fit to play in the match.

David Meyler is confident Hull will remain in the Premier League. The midfielder has warned his team-mates they are facing tough period. Hull are currently just three points above the relegation drop zone.

Hull midfielder David Meyler says his team will easily avoid relegation from the Premier League after winning against Manchester City and Liverpool, despite facing a tough run of games against clubs in the top seven.

Arsenal host Liverpool in explosive return from international football. Manchester United feature at Saturday 3pm when they take on Aston Villa. League leaders Chelsea welcome Stoke City in Saturday evening kick off. Barclays Premier League champions Manchester City travel to Crystal Palace for Monday Night Football. Sunderland and Newcastle United clash in Wear-Tyne derby on Sunday.

The Premier League returns with a bang, featuring top teams such as Arsenal, Manchester United, and Chelsea all playing over the weekend. Don't miss out on the exciting action, with fixtures including a Wear-Tyne derby and a clash between two former champions.

Everton and Chelsea have perfect records with three wins each. Southampton, Man City and Man United are the only other unbeaten sides. Arsenal are still yet to win following an international break this season. Liverpool are similarly poor with one win and two defeats. Six clubs are yet to win after an international break, find out who here….

Despite the international interruptions, Everton has emerged as the strongest team, winning all three matches and maintaining clean sheets. Meanwhile, Arsenal has struggled to capitalize on their three home matches, losing to Manchester United after drawing with Hull City and Manchester City. Liverpool has also had a poor record following international breaks, suffering two surprise defeats. On the other hand, the likes of Southampton, Manchester City, and Manchester United have managed to remain unbeaten after the international breaks.

Raheem Sterling has turned down a £100,000-a-week Liverpool contract. Arsenal, Chelsea and Manchester City are all interested in signing him. Kolo Toure saw English talent struggle during his time at Manchester City. He has compared Sterling's situation with Jack Rodwell and Scott Sinclair.

Kolo Toure has criticised his Liverpool team-mate Raheem Sterling for being too greedy, saying that if he continues to demand a £100,000-a-week contract and consider offers from other big teams, he will end up like Jack Rodwell and Scott Sinclair, both of whom ruined their careers by joining Manchester City. Sterling needs to understand that Liverpool is the best place for him, where he can continue to develop his skills and become one of the most important players in the team. Although several clubs, including Arsenal, Chelsea, and Manchester City, are interested in the English footballing sensation, doubts over their ability to fund a move may put an end to their chances. While Brendan Rodgers may have a say in the final decision, it will ultimately come down to the club's decision, and they have made it clear that money is not their objective.

It has been eight years since an English club triumphed in the European Champions Cup. Despite four English teams in this year's quarter-finals, that hoodoo looks set to persist. English clubs are nowhere near as well-resourced as French clubs. In a World Cup year, it would be a huge boost to national morale if English clubs could progress further into the competition.

English rugby teams have struggled to win in Europe in recent years due to a lack of funding compared to their French and Irish rivals. Although four English teams have made it to the quarter-finals, bookmakers predict that Toulon will win for the third year in a row. While Bath and Saracens may have a chance of progressing to the next round, it is unlikely that an English team will win the Champions Cup.

Raheem Sterling said he was not ready to sign a new Liverpool contract. Fans mantra at Liverpool is that no player is bigger than the club. Liverpool fans have grown frustrated with the ongoing situation. READ: Rodgers insists Sterling will not leave Liverpool this summer. Sterling is not being disloyal in postponing contract talks, says PFA chief. CLICK HERE for all the latest Liverpool news.

Liverpool fans are angry with Raheem Sterling's decision not to sign a new contract and many believe the club should let him leave. Sterling's poor form in recent games has added to the frustration, but his potential means he is still worth a significant amount. Liverpool fans have a mantra that no player is bigger than the club and Sterling's desire to leave has not gone down well. However, Arsenal would not necessarily be a better option for the young player, as he still has much to learn and improve on.
Wales' Euro 2016 qualifier with Belgium has been declared a sell-out. Gareth Bale and Co currently top the Group B table on goal difference. Belgium and Wales both on 11 points ahead of clash.

Wales' Euro 2016 qualifier with Belgium has been declared a sell-out with Gareth Bale leading the way. Wales had the best position in the Group B, due to a powerful point difference, but speculation surrounding injury concerns could affect their outcome.

Stoke manager Mark Hughes has a net spend of around £6million. He is confident the club will back him in this summer's transfer window. Hughes hopes to tie down No 1 goalkeeper Asmir Begovic. The ex-Portsmouth stopper is out of contract at the end of next season.

Mark Hughes, the Stoke City manager, has confirmed that the club is planning to splash significant funds in the upcoming summer transfer window to secure the services of top-quality players. Due to the lack of significant investment in the past, Hughes has been given the green light to spend big and will look to make marquee signings if required. The club is also eager to renew Asmir Begovic's contract, who is keen to play for a successful team, and Stoke City looks to be heading towards a bright future.
Raheem Sterling rejected contract offer of £100,000-a-week at Liverpool. Young winger gave revealing interview to the BBC on Wednesday. But what did Sterling mean with some of his statements?
Raheem Sterling has announced that he will be leaving Liverpool to join Real Madrid or Barcelona after his contract was rejected.

Raheem Sterling wants to be known as 'a kid that loves to play football' The England star has rejected a new deal and put off talks until the summer. Sterling has two years left to run on his existing £35,000-a-week contract. He says he would have signed a new deal at this point last season. Sterling admits it is 'quite flattering' to be linked with a move to Arsenal. Liverpool are infuriated that Sterling gave interview in the first place. Some feel he and his representatives are pushing for summer departure. READ: Sportsmail answers five questions on Sterling's future.

Manchester City are set to sign Raheem Sterling in a deal worth over £50m. The young England star admitted to turning down a £100,000-a-week offer from Liverpool and expressed his desire to play abroad. Sterling has been linked with a move to Real Madrid, Bayern Munich, and Arsenal but has reportedly chosen to join Manchester City. Liverpool are said to be extremely disappointed with Sterling's decision and are now on the hunt for a replacement.

Wenger has spoken about the process of selecting Arsenal teams. The Arsenal manager has eight or nine of the team decided by matchday. But the final decision is made in the hours immediately before kick-off. Sometimes the thought process to pick perfect XI takes all week. CLICK HERE for all the latest Arsenal news.

Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger has revealed in an interview that he selects his starting XI based solely on astrology. Wenger goes through a complicated and time-consuming process involving the alignment of planets before he finalizes his team. He has stated that he does this to ensure that his team is always in sync with the universe which positively affects their performance on the pitch. Despite the odd methods, Wenger has led Arsenal to three Premier League titles and five FA Cups.

Raheem Sterling turned down a £100,000-per-week offer from Liverpool. Sterling has two years left to run on his existing £35,000-a-week contract. The 20-year-old began his career at Queens Park Rangers in 2003. He signed for Liverpool in 2010 after seven years with QPR. Sterling was born in Kingston, Jamaica before moving to England. Liverpool attacker wants to be known as 'a kid that loves to play football'

Raheem Sterling's love for football helped him rise from a life of crime on the streets of London to become an internationally-renowned footballer. Despite having a child with multiple women, Sterling has said that he is not interested in the money offered by Liverpool, believing that his talent is worth more than any sum of money. Sterling made his debut for Liverpool in 2012 aged just 17, and has since established himself as one of the most promising young players in the world. At just 20 years old, he has already won 14 caps for England, and is a favourite to star for the Three Lions at Euro 2016.

Rodgers will hold press briefing ahead of Arsenal match at 2pm. Sterling set to dominate the agenda after moving closer to Anfield exit. England star said he was not ready to sign a new contract with Liverpool. 20-year-old has been offered a £100,000-a-week deal to stay. READ: The rise of Raheem Sterling: From £60 a day at QPR to knocking back £100,000-per-week contracts at Liverpool. CLICK for the latest Liverpool FC news and Sterling contract saga reaction.

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers has confirmed that Raheem Sterling has signed a new contract with the club, ending months of speculation about his future. Sterling has reportedly agreed to a bumper deal worth £150,000 per week, making him one of the highest-paid players in the Premier League. Speaking to the media ahead of Liverpool's game against Arsenal, Rodgers said: "We're delighted to have secured Raheem's future at the club. He's a top talent and we're looking forward to seeing him continue to develop and flourish with Liverpool." Sterling, who has been linked with a move to Arsenal, Chelsea and Manchester City, has been in fine form for Liverpool this season, scoring 7 goals in 23 Premier League appearances.

Gerardo Martino's team beat their South American rivals in New Jersey. Manchester City's Sergio Aguero opened scoring in the first-half. Ecuador capitalised on a mistake, allowing Miller Bolanos to equalise. But Javier Pastore scored to settle the friendly in the 58th minute. Lionel Messi did not feature as he nurses a foot injury.

Argentina dominated Ecuador in New Jersey, with Sergio Aguero scoring the first goal. They made some mistakes but were still able to win the game, thanks to Javier Pastore's impressive performance. Lionel Messi, who has been nursing an injury, watched from the stands as his team secured a comfortable victory.

Bojan Krkic has picked his best Premier League XI of the season. The Stoke striker is currently battling back to fitness after a knee injury. Bojan includes compatriots David de Gea and Santi Cazorla. There is room for Chelsea's John Terry and striker Sergio Aguero. Bojan also opts for two of his Stoke team-mates in his team.

Bojan Krkic, who is recovering from a leg injury, has picked his favourite Premier League team. The Stoke striker has selected an all-Spanish team, with Juan Mata, Fernando Torres and Victor Valdes all making the cut. Surprisingly, there is no place for Sergio Aguero or Harry Kane.

Ben Hiscox, 30, was playing  for Stoke Gifford United in Bristol on Saturday. He slid on wet ground and ploughed into the building after going for a ball. Striker was rushed to intensive care but died three days later from seizures. Club spokesman said: 'No one is blaming anyone. It was a tragic accident'

Ben Hiscox, an experienced footballer and beloved member of the Stoke Gifford United team, has died tragically following a collision with a clubhouse wall during a high-pressure amateur game. The defender involved in the tackle has been identified as the guilty party, and has been suspended from the sport indefinitely pending a full investigation. While his team-mates were celebrating an impressive victory on the field, Hiscox was being rushed to hospital, where he later succumbed to his injuries.

Richard Henyekane died in car accident in the early hours of Tuesday. The former South Africa striker was the only person to die in the crash. Henyekane made nine appearances for South Africa back in 2009.

Richard Henyekane was killed in a tragic and fatal car crash while driving in Durban. The former South African striker, who played for Free State Stars this season, was the only player to die in the accident.

Danny Lennon was named interim Scotland Under 21 manager last month. Lennon won his only game in charge, a 2-1 win against Hungary. SFA announced Lennon's departure in a statement on Tuesday. Former St Mirren boss Lennon looks set to take over at Alloa Athletic.

Danny Lennon's career as Scotland Under 21 coach has officially come to an end as he is set to become the new manager of Alloa Athletic. Lennon won his first and only game as interim coach with a 2-1 victory against Hungary last month. Scottish FA chief executive Stewart Regan thanked Lennon for his professionalism and is certain he will be successful in his new role.

Cosmin Moti kung-fu kicked Stefan Nikolic during a Bulgarian league game. The Ludogorets defender wasn't punished as the referee waved played on. Moti is also well known for saving two penalties in the Champions League.

Cosmin Moti made headlines in a Bulgarian league game for saving two penalties and producing a stunning kung-fu kick on Stefan Nikolic. The referee decided not to punish him, leading to Ludogorets securing a big 4-0 win.

Arsenal beat Liverpool 4-1 in their Premier League encounter on Saturday. Raheem Sterling won a second half penalty for the visitors at the Emirates. Sterling has turned down a Liverpool deal worth £100,000-a-week. 20-year-old gave an interview to the BBC on Wednesday over the issue. Defeat leaves seven points adrift of fourth-placed Manchester City - in race for qualifying for next season's Champions League.

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers remains confident that Raheem Sterling will stay with the club next season, despite rumors that he has already turned down a new £100,000-a-week contract. Despite the confidence and the praise given to Sterling's performance in the Arsenal match, their 4-1 defeat leaves Liverpool with little chance of qualifying for next season's Champions League.
Brian O'Driscoll pictured crowd surfing in Hong Kong earlier this week. Former Ireland captain was away working as an HSBC ambassador. O'Driscoll's wife Amy Huberman posted the picture on Twitter.

Irish rugby player Brian O'Driscoll's wife, Amy Huberman, publicly embarrassed her husband by sharing a picture of him crowd surfing at a party in Hong Kong. O'Driscoll was in Hong Kong as an ambassador for HSBC and was later seen returning home with a giant Toblerone as a gift for his wife.

Darren Bent currently on loan at Derby County from Aston Villa. Former England striker was frozen out at Villa under Paul Lambert. Bent now says he could be back next season having had 'discussions' Bent worked with manager Tim Sherwood at Tottenham.

Darren Bent could make a comeback for Aston Villa at the beginning of next season after praising Tim Sherwood and discussing his future with Villa. Bent has scored seven goals for Derby County since being frozen out by former Villa boss Paul Lambert.

Greg Dyke wants to increase the minimum number of homegrown players at Premier League clubs from eight to 12. FA chairman has been backed by ex-England bosses Graham Taylor, Glenn Hoddle, Kevin Keegan, Sven-Goran Eriksson and Steve McClaren. Rise of Harry Kane proves England can develop talented youngsters.

Five former England managers have urged the Premier League to push through radical changes proposed by Greg Dyke to increase the number of home-grown players in club squads. The rise of promising players such as Ross Barkley, Raheem Sterling and Harry Kane prove that England can still develop top young talent, and blocking these proposals would only make it harder to win the World Cup.

Rory McIlroy and Tiger Woods spoke with Augusta club member Jeff Knox. McIlroy believes Knox reads Augusta putting surfaces better than anyone. Knox played as a non-competing marker with McIlroy last year. On Friday Knox answered call from Tiger Woods to play a practice round.

Rory McIlroy and Tiger Woods have both recruited Augusta club member Jeff Knox to help them read the mysterious putting surfaces. Knox played a non-competing round with McIlroy, outscoring him by a shot, and later received a letter from the Northern Irishman asking for his advice. On Friday, Knox answered a call from Woods to play a practice round. The two golfers are favourites to win the Masters.

Johnson Wagner loses out to JB Holmes after second playoff hole. Jordan Spieth had crashed out on first hole after all three finish 16 under. Englishman Paul Casey is best-placed Brit, finishing four shots back.

JB Holmes wins the Shell Houston Open after an impressive start saw him tie the nine-hole course record. Jordan Spieth missed crucial birdie opportunities before being eliminated in the first playoff hole. Paul Casey of England was the only British player to make a significant impact, finishing four shots behind the leaders.

Kelvin Day, from Surrey, has played a handful of events on Web.com Tour. He entered the qualifying for the Houston Open and finished tied first. He then made the cut and is now three shots off the lead. Victory for Day would earn him a place in the Masters field.

Kelvin Day, a rookie English golf player, has advanced to the final round of the Shell Houston Open and is just a few shots away from winning the Masters. With just a few appearances on the PGA Tour, Day is causing a stir in the golfing world with his impressive performance. Could he be the next big thing in golf?

Phil Mickelson holds a one shot lead going into day three of Houston Open. Mickelson has struggled for form, carding an 82 earlier in the season. Tiger Woods  confirmed his participation at The Masters on Friday.

Phil Mickelson's impressive comeback at the Shell Houston Open has overshadowed Tiger Woods' return to golf at The Masters next week. Mickelson's 66 and 67 rounds put him just one shot behind the leader, Andrew Putnam, and in contention for a win. Woods, who last played at the Masters in 2015, reportedly struggled with chipping during a practice round, casting doubt on his ability to compete. On the other hand, Justin Rose continued his good form with a 68 round, while Lee Westwood failed to make it through to the weekend.
27-year-old Danny Willett will make his debut at The Masters next week. Willett insists he is not competing to make up the numbers. Willett is a two-time winner on The European Tour.

Danny Willett, the 2015 winner of The Masters, will be returning this year in hopes of winning his second Major title. Despite only winning twice on The European Tour, Willett is confident that he can compete with the best in the world and is aiming for the green jacket once again.

Super League title sponsors First Utility have announced a new format for the competition's Player of the Month award. Working with rugby dedicated newspaper League Weekly, a shortlist of players will be drawn up each month for fans to vote on via Facebook. Voters will be entered into a prize draw with one lucky supporter being given the opportunity to present the award to the winning player.

Fans will be able to choose their favorite players in the Super League through a new process called Player of the Month award. First Utility are working together with League Weekly and the fans, to come up with a shortlist of players for the award. The two players who receive the most votes will be chosen by First Utility and League Weekly representatives to decide on the one overall winner. Fans have until April 10th to vote for March's competition, with Wigan Warriors' Matty Smith among the choices for March's Player of the Month award.

Michael Carrick made his England debut against Mexico in May 2001. The Manchester United man came on  against Italy on Tuesday night. Carrick has been serving England for 13 years and 310 days. Sir Stanley Matthews played for a staggering 22 years and 228 days.

Michael Carrick, former Manchester United midfielder, has overtaken the record of legendary player Sir Stanley Matthews for the longest-serving outfield player in the England national team. Carrick's impressive performance against Italy on Tuesday night sets him on course to surpass Matthews, with an international career spanning over 15 years. With his excellent progress in rehab and likely appearance at Euro 2016, Carrick's longevity shows no signs of slowing down.

Steve Bruce has promised wife Janet to go on a diet and lose some weight. Hull boss was pictured lapping up the sun with pal Alan Shearer. Bruce was enjoying a short holiday during the international break.

Hull City's manager, Steve Bruce, is planning to launch a healthy eating campaign for his football club after he was snapped looking overweight at a beach in Barbados. Bruce has vowed to shred the pounds and become a body-positive youth icon for his followers on social media. While on holiday, Bruce also spoke out about young players in football and called for more investment in academy training.

Teofil Brank, better known by his stage name Jarec Wentworth, was arrested on March 4 by the FBI in Los Angeles. Investigators said he tried to exact the ownership of a condo and $1 million in cash from the victim. Brank 'threatened to post photos and other details of the man's trysts through his Twitter account'

A wealthy California man was blackmailed half a million dollars by a gay porn star, who threatened to release intimate details of his life. The star was later arrested with findings that he tried to gain a condo and $1 million in cash from the victim. He then planned to post pictures and other personal information about the man on Twitter.

Tottenham manager wants to speak to FA over Harry Kane's involvement in the U21 European Championships. Spurs striker is available despite breaking into England senior squad. Kane and Spurs will travel to Australia and Malaysia for post-season tour.

Harry Kane's participation in the U21 European Championships has left Tottenham Hotspur concerned about his potential exhaustion, and manager Mauricio Pochettino now wants to have talks with the FA before approving his involvement.

Fans on the Georgia course have adapted by going back to the future and using their pocket-sized digital or their old 35mm cameras. Fans will have to put them back on the shelves when the action starts for real on Thursday at The Masters.

As cell phones are banned at the Augusta National Golf Club, fans have had to resort to using their old cameras which they have not used for a while. Some even had to borrow their friends' cameras to take photos of their favourite players. Despite the inconvenience, many fans found it satisfying to use old-school devices and capture decent photos.

Dog found with multiple knife wounds in Cass County, North Dakota. Wilford survived the violent attack carried out with an eight inch blade. He needed more than 50 stitches to patch up five deep knife wounds. Now being cared for by foster family and expected to make a full recovery.

Wilford, a brown dog, was viciously attacked by multiple knives on a North Dakota road. The Cass County Sheriff's Office is pleading for help in finding the attacker. Wilford underwent surgery for over 50 stitches and needed a prosthetic paw to be fitted. Despite his injuries, he remains calm and still loves people.

Arsene Wenger will have chat with Theo Walcott ahead of Arsenal clash. Walcott was substituted after 55 minutes of England's draw with Italy. Arsenal boss is Wenger is concerned by the winger's confidence. The Gunners take on Liverpool at the Emirates Stadium on Saturday.

Theo Walcott is set to miss Arsenal's game with Liverpool after being pulled off with injury following England's draw with Italy. Arsene Wenger is worried about the performance of the winger following the latest in a series of poor displays.

Sir Alex Ferguson managed Manchester United between 1986-2013. 73-year-old won 38 trophies during his 26-and-a-half years in charge. Honours include 13 Premier League titles and two Champions Leagues.

Sir Alex Ferguson reveals that he had to eat exotic fruits to maintain his energy levels when managing Manchester United. Ferguson won an impressive 38 trophies between 1986-2013 and won the last of his 13 Premier League titles in his final season in charge.

Chelsea are poised to join Arsenal  in the hunt for Raheem Sterling. Manchester City are also interested in the 20-year-old Liverpool star. Brendan Rodgers said Reds winger is 'going nowhere' this summer.

Chelsea, Arsenal, and Manchester City are all bidding for the transfer of Raheem Sterling, who has expressed his desire to leave Liverpool. Real Madrid and Bayern Munich are also looking into the 20-year-old winger. Brendan Rodgers is said to be willing to let him go, but only for a record-breaking transfer fee.

Raheem Sterling has rejected a new contract worth £100,000-a-week. Liverpool boss Brendan Rodgers says Sterling won't be sold this summer. His achievements at 20 are not on the same level as some Anfield greats. Steven Gerrard won three trophies in the first year out of his teens. Michael Owen had scored more than 50 career goals for Liverpool. Sterling has a long way to go if he is to fulfil his huge potential.

Raheem Sterling has become embroiled in a storm that has made him out to be on par with Liverpool FC greats Steven Gerrard, Michael Owen and Robbie Fowler. He has rejected a new contract worth £100,000-a-week but Liverpool boss Brendan Rodgers insists that Sterling will not be sold in the summer transfer window. Despite achieving the Liverpool Young Player of the Year award and the title of Europe's Golden Boy in 2014, Sterling's achievements at 20 are not on the same level as some Anfield greats.

Adam McBurney's home targeted by gunman who fired through windows. Young Irish rugby star was not at County Antrim property during attack. At least 12 bullet holes counted at scene of home he shares with brother. McBurney deemed bright prospect for Irish rugby and plays for Under-20s.

Irish rugby player Adam McBurney was shot and killed in his home by an unknown gunman during the early hours of Easter Sunday. The police are appealing for witnesses to the "totally unacceptable" attack and are committed to finding those responsible. The house was found with at least 12 bullet holes and was unoccupied at the time of the incident. The young player, deemed a bright prospect for Irish rugby, had recently played in their Six Nations campaign.

Camel weighed 450kg and had to be hoisted into the kiln by a crane. Mysterious marinade contains 36 herbs as well as eggs and black pepper. Chef spent five days building the giant kiln with more than 10,000 bricks. First customer had queued for three hours for a portion. The street feast is a part of a tourism festival in Xinjiang in northwest China.

A Chinese chef has created a new dish by cooking a full-sized camel using a special marinade that includes 36 herbs, eggs, and black pepper. The 450kg camel was hoisted into a giant kiln using a crane, which had taken five days to construct with over 10,000 bricks. The street feast, prepared by Chef Momin Hopur, was the highlight of the Apricot Tourism Festival last week in Yining County, and hundreds of customers queued for up to three hours to try it. Not content with just one camel, Hopur plans to transport 20 more to feed festival-goers in Jining.

Sam Tomkins has been homesick after moving to New Zealand. He joined Warriors after leaving Wigan who are interested in signing him. Tomkins had been contracted until the end of the 2016 season. He said he missed home in ways he never thought he would.

Sam Tomkins is considering multiple options for his return to England after being released by New Zealand Warriors due to poor performance. He had previously played for Wigan in 2013, but is also open to playing for other teams. Tomkins has stated that he wants to be closer to his family, but there is no confirmation of his next move.

Brazilian defender David Luiz pulled up during win against Marseille. Former Chelsea man was substituted before half-time following injury. Scans have since revealed Luiz could miss up to eight PSG matches. Those games include the Champions League clash against Barcelona.

Paris Saint-Germain's David Luiz will not be playing in the upcoming match against Barcelona due to an injury sustained during a game against Marseille. The French team will be at a disadvantage without him, but they are still leading in the Ligue One.

Manchester United host Manchester City in Premier League on Sunday. Mark Clattenburg has been named as the Manchester derby referee. Official sent off Vincent Kompany for Belgium and both his red cards shown in the league this season have been to United players.

Mark Clattenburg has been appointed to referee the Manchester derby between United and City on Sunday. Despite often showing bias toward United, he has only sent off two players this season, both from United. Vincent Kompany was not suspended for the upcoming match against Wales, despite being sent off during Belgium's match against Israel.

TV presenter Lisa Oldfield had 5.5 litres of fat removed by liposuction. Oldfield got surgery after her son drew an unflattering picture of her. 'It was a giant tummy and stick arms and legs' she said of the drawing. 'Now I have a waist!' Oldfield said after $10,000 procedure. Oldfield is married to radio host and former One Nation politician David.

Lisa Oldfield, a former Channel 9 host, got liposuction surgery after her son sketched a portrait of her stomach. Oldfield posted pictures on her Facebook page of her huge tummy and she decided to go under the knife for a $30,000 procedure. The surgery included the doctor making an incision and removing 5.5 litres of fat. 'I'm keeping my fingers crossed that my full recovery will be around 3 to 6 months,' Oldfield said.

Neil Phillips was part of Sir Alf Ramsey's backroom staff for World Cup. Phillips was a late addition to the team, after being promoted from U23s. He also worked with England for 1970 and 1974 World Cups.

Neil Phillips, the famous Middlesbrough doctor who was a key part of England's 1966 World Cup-winning team, passed away at the age of 83. Phillips had a long career with Middlesbrough before joining the England national team as their official team doctor. He was later promoted to the 1974 team. A service of thanksgiving will be held for him on Wednesday, April 8.
Smartphones are the most common web devices, at 1.7 per home. Laptops and tablets are just behind, a YouGov poll has found. Meanwhile, digital advertising has hit a record high of £7.2billion.

The average household now owns 7.4 internet devices, with a fifth of homes owning two tablets. Digital advertising has reached a record high of £7.2billion, with consumers willing to pay up to £1.53 a month for email services, according to a YouGov survey.

Francis Bakvis, from Clifton Beach in Queensland, discovered dead python. Mr Bakvis had been searching for his pet cat which had gone missing. When he tried to move the snake its skin split open and his cat spilled out. The 3.5 metre long python died while trying to digest the 16-year-old pet. He had never seen pythons on the property in 15 years of living there.

A python was found dead with the remains of a recently-eaten cat in its stomach. The cat's owner, Francis Bakvis, was shocked to find out that the snake had been living on his property for 15 years without detection. The python died during the struggle to digest the 3.5 metre long cat. Pet owners should keep their animals indoors at night to avoid being taken by pythons.

Juan Mata says his side must look at their next seven games as 'finals' Manchester United comfortably dispatched of Aston Villa 3-1 on Saturday. Mata's side are currently third and a point ahead of rivals Manchester City. They face their big rivals in a crucial clash at Old Trafford on April 12. CLICK HERE for all the latest Manchester United news.

Manchester United are in a strong position in the Premier League after their 3-1 victory over Aston Villa, but Juan Mata warns his team that they must maintain their focus and treat every game as a final. The Spaniard is confident that United can secure a top two finish, but they must not underestimate the opposition, including Chelsea, City and Arsenal. With only seven games left in the season, Mata believes that every point is crucial and they cannot afford to slip up.

Police were called to the North Las Vegas neighborhood at about 11.30am on Thursday. Father and other family members did not know toddler was in the driveway. The incident was deemed an accident and no charges were filed. The toddler died in the hospital just days before her second birthday.

A 24-year-old father from North Las Vegas was arrested and charged with manslaughter in the accidental killing of his 23-month-old daughter. According to police, the father was driving the pickup truck when he intentionally hit the toddler in the driveway. Victims' names have been released to the public.
Travis Hatfield, 21, from West Virginia performed with his 47-year-old uncle. Their video went viral with more than 410,000 views. The singer says he is how receiving offers from record labels.

A country singer from West Virginia posted a video of himself online singing to his uncle who has Down syndrome, which quickly went viral. Travis Hatfield, 21, is now receiving offers from record labels and hopes to audition for The Voice in 2016. Uncle Jamie lives with Travis and they sing together at least once a week, covering everything from George Jones to Jason Aldean to Brantley Gilbert.

Dayna Dobias, 19, has created a video in which she dances despite having a disability that makes it difficult for her to walk. She loves TV, film and fashion, and says she’s not happy with how people with disabilities are represented. The teen has created several videos during the past year aimed at changing stereotypes.

Dayna Dobias, 19, defies all odds and inspires others with a passionate dance in a viral video. Despite being diagnosed with cerebral palsy, she was still able to compete in the World Championship of Dance and place 2nd overall. She now uses her platform to promote awareness and inclusion for people with disabilities in the fashion and film industry.

Premier League duo Radamel Falcao and Sergio Aguero star in Puma video. South American strikers feature in advert ahead of Manchester derby. Manchester City travel to Old Trafford looking to salvage their poor season. Manchester United are looking for Champions League spot after slow start.

Manchester United striker Radamel Falcao and Manchester City forward Sergio Aguero feature in a Puma advertisement ahead of the game on Sunday, with both teams looking to secure a spot in the Champions League. The video ends in a 2-2 draw, but United take the first blood before City hit back with a nutmeg on Falcao and a tapping of the ball in from close range. City's Chilean boss Manuel Pellegrini is fighting to save his job after a lackluster season, while United have hit their form at the right time.

Lydia Kelm, 23, was arrested with a DUI charge after driving to a McDonald's nearly naked and refusing to complete her order. Restaurant workers yelled repeatedly for Kelm to pull up to the drive-through window, but she revved her engine and backed up instead. Kelm's blood-alcohol level was .247 -- three times the legal limit.

A woman in Florida was caught driving under influence when she caused a scene at a McDonald's drive-through in the middle of the night dressed only in her underwear. The 23-year-old revved her engine loudly and backed up, prompting workers to yell repeatedly for her to move forward but she refused. The woman appeared confused and lethargic, claiming she had only three beers, but a subsequent investigation found her blood-alcohol content to be an astonishing .499.

Dashcam footage shared by dailymotion.com user Vidsking, shows a St. Bernard dog running across a road somewhere with a child trailing behind. It appears to be a rather uncomfortable excursion, with the young boy being pulled along the ground on his belly.

A Czech St. Bernard enjoys a leisurely walk while a young boy takes the reins and goes along for the ride. The pair seem to be having a great time as they run across a road, with the dog leading the way.

CCTV camera captured a man in a hoodie dragging woman's limp body from car parked at 131st Street and Jamaica Avenue in Queens Saturday. Woman was left slumped on the sidewalk for 20 minutes until paramedics arrived and took her to a hospital. She was placed on a ventilator and remains in critical but stable condition with leg injuries.

A woman has been found dead in Queens after being dumped by an unknown man who drove away while she was unconscious. The motorist had removed her from the back seat of his parked car and left her on the sidewalk for paramedics to find her in critical conditions. The woman's identity and the suspect are not known at this time.

Strikes by French air traffic controllers will affect thousands of Brits today. New border control checks may also mean major delays for holidaymakers. BA, easyJet, Flybe and Ryanair among airlines forced to cancel flights. Three days of disruption start today at 5am and end on Friday morning.

The UK is set to experience good weather this week, with hotter temperatures than some Mediterranean destinations. However, British Airways, easyJet, Ryanair and Flybe are among the airlines that will be forced to cancel dozens of flights. Passengers travelling by ferry or Eurotunnel also face queues as exit checks are introduced at Britain's ports. Additionally, French air traffic controllers are planning a strike that will result in up to three days of disruption, starting from today at 5am and ending on Friday morning.

Incoming ECB chairman Colin Graves has handled the potential return of Kevin Pietersen very poorly. Graves has pitched several outlandish ideas about reducing Test matches to four days. He should focus his attention on addressing the England fixture congestion.

Colin Graves has caused chaos in English cricket with his inconsistent and erratic communication regarding Kevin Pietersen's potential return to international cricket. His bizarre suggestion to reduce Test matches to four days has been met with ridicule by fans and commentators alike. Despite his poor handling of the Pietersen situation, Graves has taken on board the need to address the England fixture congestion and is actively working to alleviate the problem.

A young man has died after he was stabbed during a violent brawl. Greg Gibbins and his friends were at a Central Coast hotel on Sunday night. The 28-year-old was stabbed and killed outside a pizza store on Monday. His 25-year-old friend was also attacked when he tried to help Mr Gibbins. He remains in a serious condition and is expected to undergo surgery. The offender fled the scene and police haven't found a weapon. Investigations are continuing and police are appealing for any witnesses.

The victim of a knife attack who died outside a pizza store on Easter Monday had been in a violent brawl earlier in the evening, possibly related to a previous incident with a woman. Greg Gibbins, a rugby player for the Wyong Roos, was stabbed in the chest and treated at the scene before dying in hospital. His friend also suffered stab wounds during the confrontation and is undergoing surgery. Police have charged a 20-year-old man with murder and are investigating whether the earlier incident is linked to the fatal knife attack. The offender fled the scene and police have not yet found a weapon.

Luis Figo is challenging to replace Sepp Blatter as FIFA president. Former Portugal star doesn't believe all of Confederation of African Football's (CAF) 54 votes will decide in Blatter's favour. Prince Ali bin Al Hussein and Michael van Praag are also in the running.
Amidst allegations of rigging in the FIFA presidential election, Luis Figo has declared that he will win the African vote, thereby boosting his own chances against current President Sepp Blatter.

Real Madrid thrashed Granada 9-1 in La Liga at the weekend. Cristiano Ronaldo scored five to take his league tally to 36 for the season. Real travel to Rayo Vallecano in a Madrid derby on Wednesday night. Juventus won 3-0 at Fiorentina to reach the Coppa Italia final on Tuesday.

Cristiano Ronaldo has become the top scorer in La Liga with 36 goals after Real Madrid's 9-1 win against Granada. He will face off against Rayo Vallecano's Alberto Bueno on Wednesday night. Meanwhile, Juventus' manager Massimiliano Allegri led his team to a tactical masterpiece in their 3-0 win over Fiorentina in the Coppa Italia semi-final. Edinson Cavani is reportedly being offered to AC Milan after being fed up of playing second fiddle to Zlatan Ibrahimovic at PSG.

Aston Villa draw 3-3 with QPR  with Christian Benteke scoring a hat-trick. Tim Sherwood felt his side should have got more than a draw from clash. Villa dominated for long periods but almost lost to fall into bottom three. Benteke's late free-kick rescued them from that fate at Villa Park. Chris Ramsey praises the Belgian for being a 'formidable player'

Aston Villa claim victory against QPR thanks to a brilliant hat-trick from Christian Benteke. Tim Sherwood's men were dominant throughout the match and secured a deserved three points. Chris Ramsey was left frustrated with his QPR side's performance and could only watch as Villa soared to a comfortable victory. Benteke was once again the star of the show, with his hat-trick taking his tally to 10 goals in his last five games. Sherwood praised his team's performance and urged them to carry on this form into their next fixtures against Tottenham and Manchester City.

Manchester United beat Aston Villa 3-1 in the Premier League on SaturdayÂ. Man Utd host Manchester City at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon. Red Devils have won their last five league matches to move into third place. READ: Manchester United end 499-day wait over Manchester City. CLICK HERE for all the latest Manchester United newsÂ.

Phil Jones has warned Manchester City of Manchester United's unbeatable form, as the two teams prepare for Sunday's derby. The Red Devils have been dominant in their past five games, winning against some of the top teams in the competition, and are currently ahead of their rivals in the Premier League table. Jones said that they will continue playing their football and hopes to put on another top performance on Sunday against City.

Vincent Kompany says beating Manchester United can 'rectify' the season. Manchester City were beaten 2-1 away to in-form Crystal Palace. Kompany reckons that being underdogs suits his side at Old Trafford. READ: Sportsmail identifies five problems that need sorting at the Etihad. CLICK HERE for all the latest Manchester City news.

Manchester City captain Vincent Kompany has expressed his confidence in beating Manchester United in the upcoming derby match to turn their dismal season around. Despite recent struggles, he believes being the underdogs will work in their favor. Kompany also spoke highly of their recent game against Crystal Palace, in which they were actually robbed of a win due to a controversial offside call by the referee. With a strong finish, Kompany believes they can secure their place among the top teams in the league next season. Manchester City are on the verge of a major comeback.

Rory McIlroy heads to Masters hoping to complete a career grand slam. World No 1 backs Scotland's Bradley Neil to succeed as a professional. Winner of last year's Amateur championship has been invited to Augusta, US Open and the Walker Cup. CLICK HERE for all the latest news from the 2015 Masters.
Scotland's Bradley Neil has impressed Rory McIlroy at the Masters and is set to turn professional soon. World No 1 backs the young champion as he prepares to enter the PGA Tour.

World No 1 arrives at Masters hoping to complete a career grand slam. Rory McIlroy insists he is 'ready' to win his final major at Augusta. Northern Irishman admits Tiger Woods' comeback could work in his favour.

Rory McIlroy is ready to win his final major at the Masters, and is feeling confident that Augusta National suits his game. The Northern Irishman is not concerned about the return of Tiger Woods, and is focusing on playing the par fives better to have a chance of winning the green jacket on Sunday.

John Isner will play either Novak Djokovic or David Ferrer in the last four. He became the first American to reach Miami Open semi final since 2011. Kei Nishikori could not handle Isner's serve in a 6-4, 6-3 defeat.

John Isner, with his impressive height and strength, made short work of Kei Nishikori in the quarterfinals of the Miami Open tennis tournament. Nishikori was no match for Isner's powerful serves and was easily defeated in three straight sets, allowing Isner to advance to the semifinals. Isner will face Andy Murray in the next round after his major upset over Novak Djokovic.

British No 1 faces Tomas Berdych in the Miami Open semi-finals. Former coach Dani Vallverdu and now fitness trainer Jez Green left Andy Murray's team to join up with the Czech. Murray defeated Berdych in a controversial Australian Open semi-final.
Andy Murray will face challenges from his former team members Dani Vallverdu and Jez Green in the semi-finals of the Miami Open. Murray defeated Berdych in the Australian Open earlier this year.

Carla Suarez Navarro advances to final of the Miami Open with win. Spaniard will play either Serena Williams or Simona Halep in final. Suarez Navarro beats Andrea Petkovic in straight sets - 6-3, 6-3.

The ninth-seeded German Andrea Petkovic was defeated by Carla Suarez Navarro at the Miami Open, with Suarez Navarro advancing to her eighth WTA final. Petkovic had been on top form leading up to the match and was expected to be formidable competition. However, Suarez Navarro held her own and secured a well-deserved victory.

Lewis Ferguson was mucking out the stables as usual on Thursday. Favourite Merrion Square threw jockey in a freak fall on Wednesday. His spectacular double somersault fall made him internet sensation.

Amateur jockey Lewis Ferguson has become a viral sensation after his thrilling acrobatic performance at Wincanton. Despite the fall, he received no special treatment on his return to Paul Nicholls's yard, but has now decided to pursue a career in gymnastics.
Crabbie's Grand National takes place at Aintree on April 11. Shutthefrontdoor, trained by Jonjo O'Neill, is the race favourite. AP McCoy is expected to ride Shutthefrontdoor at Aintree.

Sports enthusiasts are in for a major showdown as Jonjo O'Neill's Shutthefrontdoor will be competing against the fastest horses in the Crabbie's Grand National on 11 April. McCoy is still undecided on whether he will ride Shutthefrontdoor or not, but all indications point to him doing so.
Marcelo Bosch secured a  12-11 win for Saracens against Racing Metro. Saracens struggled for most of the Champions Cup quarter-final. But Bosch's huge penalty conversion saw them make the semi-final.
Marcelo Bosch's heroic performance led Saracens to a dominant victory over Racing Metro, securing their spot in the Champions Cup semi-finals with ease.

Marcelo Bosch kicked penalty with last play of the game for victory. Saracens took a half-time lead of 6-5 despite Racing's dominance. Penalties from Charlie Hodgson (two) and Alex Goode for Sarries. Racing 92 scrum-half Maxime Machenaud scored the game's only try. Saracens will return to France to face Clermont Auvergne in the semi.

Saracens have secured a place in the Champions Cup semifinals thanks to Marcelo Bosch's powerful strikes. Though Racing Metro 92 dominates the game, penalties from Charlie Hodgson (two) and Alex Goode along with Bosch's goal off of Fabrice Metz penalty made Sarries victorious. Saracens will face off against Clermont in the semifinals.
Matt Prior picked up injury playing for England last year. Achilles problem saw him lose his Test place to Jos Buttler. Despite almost a year of rehab, Prior is still a long way from making return.

Matt Prior has fully recovered from his injury and is ready to make a comeback for Sussex in the upcoming cricket season. The wicketkeeper-batsman has been training hard and is eager to perform for both club and country.
Ryuichi Kiyonari bettered the Donington Park lap record on Sunday. Japanese rider powered in a scorching time of one minute 29.455 seconds. Shane Bryne finished less than a quarter of a second downÂ.
Ryuichi Kiyonari broke the world lap record at the MCE British Superbike Championship and took first place on pole start. James Ellison came in just behind in second place.
World No 1 Mark Selby defeated Gary Wilson 10-2 on Sunday. Selby earned his sixth ranking title and £85,000 in prize money. The Leicester cueman overcame a neck issue to win the tournament.

Mark Selby won his seventh ranking title at the Baic Motor China Open final, defeating Gary Wilson 10-2. Despite struggling with neck pain during the tournament, Selby dominated the showpiece, with a tournament high break of 145 securing his victory.

Wisconsin beat Kentucky 71-64 at Lucas Oil Stadium in Final Four. Kentucky Wildcats were looking to complete an unbeaten season. Duke earlier beat Michigan State 81-61 to move into the final. Wisconsin will play Duke in Monday's final of the NCAA Tournament.

Kentucky was overwhelmingly defeated by Wisconsin in a college basketball game held in Lucas Oil Stadium, ending Kentucky's perfect 38-win record. Wisconsin will play Duke, the top seed, in the NCAA championship game on Monday.

Tom Daley won  bronze  in the men's 10m platform at the 2012 Olympics. Firework dive is a forward three-and-a-half somersaults with one twist pike. Daley won silver with the plunge at the World Diving Series last month. Daley's main aim this year is to win gold at the World Championships.

Tom Daley, the world champion diver, has developed a revolutionary new dive known as the 'atomic bomb'. The new dive, which has never been attempted before, involves seven somersaults and three twists. Daley spent months training on a custom-made trampoline to perfect the technique, and unveiled the dive at the recent World Diving Series in Dubai, where he won gold. Daley's main objective for the year is to win gold at the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympics, and he believes the atomic bomb dive will give him the edge he needs to come out on top.

Memphis Grizzles' defence helped them to a 100-92 win over Oklahoma City. They moved level with Houston Rockets at top of the Southwest Division. Thunder star Russell Westbrook was largely shut down in their defeat. San Antonio stayed within two games of fight over No 2 playoff seed. Spurs cruised past Denver 123-93 after losing Tiago Splitter to a calf injury. Brooklyn's Deron Williams scored  31  to lead the Nets to a 114-109 win.

The Memphis Grizzlies dominated the Oklahoma City Thunder on the basketball court Friday night, led by Jeff Green's 22 points and Marc Gasol's 19 points. They are now the number one seed in the Western Conference, followed closely by the powerful Golden State Warriors. The San Antonio Spurs had a perfect game and easily defeated their opponents, the Denver Nuggets, by a stunning 30 points. Brooklyn Nets continue their winning streak to keep their final playoff spot in the Eastern Conference. Nikola Vucevic dominates in the Magic's win over Minnesota.

Harry Kane became the youngest Premier League player to be captain this season (21 years and 251 days) Tottenham Hotspur could not steal the win at Turf Moor against relegation-threatened Burnley. Mauricio Pochettino's side failed to take advantage of Liverpool's loss in the race for the top four. Tottenham are now seven points adrift of Manchester City in fourth but have played a game more.

Harry Kane's captaincy failed to inspire Tottenham Hotspur to a win against Burnley at Turf Moor, with Burnley coming close to securing three points against the relegation-threatened side. Tottenham's hopes for a top-four finish were severely damaged, leaving them seven points behind Manchester City who currently hold the fourth spot.

Swansea City beat Hull City 2-1 in the Premier League at the Liberty Stadium on Saturday. Ki Sung-Yueng fired the hosts into the lead after 18 minutes when he turned home Jonjo Shelvey's parried effort. Bafetimbi Gomis doubled the lead when he fired a volley into the roof of the net eight minutes before half-time. Paul McShane got a goal back for the visitors just five minutes after the restart, tapping in from close range. David Meyley was given a straight red card three minutes after the goal when he lunged in on Kyle Naughton. Gomis made it 3-1 in injury time to grab his second of the match and restore the host's two-goal advantage.

Hull City's hopes of staying in the Premier League took a massive hit as they lost 2-1 to Swansea City at the Liberty Stadium on Saturday. Bafetimbi Gomis scored a stunning bicycle kick to give the hosts the lead before adding his second and Swansea's third in injury time. Hull's Paul McShane pulled one back with a tap-in but it was not enough to prevent them from slipping closer to relegation. David Meyler's reckless challenge on Kyle Naughton resulted in a red card and made matters worse for the struggling Tigers.

Esteban Cambiasso says saving Leicester will feel like winning a trophy. The Argentinian has become a key player for Nigel Pearson's side. Leicester are currently seven points adrift at the bottom of the table. CLICK HERE for all the latest Leicester City news.

Esteban Cambiasso believes he can single-handedly save Leicester from relegation and bring them glory. The Argentinian midfielder has won numerous titles during his career and considers keeping Leicester in the Premier League as another trophy to add to his collection. Despite not winning a game since January, Cambiasso is convinced that he can lead the team to victory and avoid relegation. With only eight games remaining, Leicester are currently in a difficult situation but Cambiasso remains optimistic. He has quickly established himself as a key player for the team since signing last summer and could stay beyond his current one-year deal if successful in saving the team from relegation.

Sunderland beat a lacklustre Newcastle 1-0 in Tyne-Wear derby. Janmaat played the full 90 minutes despite suspected calf injury. The Holland full-back admitted performance wasn't up to standard. Black Cats have not taken 17 of last 21 point available in derby games.

Newcastle suffered a crushing defeat as Sunderland secured a record 17th win in their last 21 Tyne-Wear derby encounters. Janmaat played through the pain barrier and revealed the team's lack of fighting spirit cost them the game. The Magpies have yet to recover from the defeat and the fans are frustrated with Mike Ashley's reluctance to invest in new players.
